0.title: Chennai man who died in police custody had 13 wounds: Post-mortem report
0.article_body: Post-mortem report of the 25-year-old man, Vignesh, who had died in police custody in Chennai last month, has revealed that he had 13 different wounds, including 12 contusions and one abrasion. Earlier, a CCTV footage showing policemen running after him and beating him had surfaced online. He had been arrested on April 18 over alleged possession of marijuana.

1.title: I feel like what the guys in 'Lagaan' movie felt: RCB's Harshal Patel on win vs CSK
1.article_body: Referring to their 13-run win against CSK, RCB bowling all-rounder Harshal Patel said, "Very satisfying. I feel like what the guys in 'Lagaan' movie felt after they won the match and it started raining." He added, "It was a drought for the team and myself as well. Really happy that we're over that now." Harshal took three wickets against CSK.

2.title: Warning issued for fresh spell of heatwave over 6 states/UTs; list released
2.article_body: The IMD has said that a fresh spell of heatwave conditions is likely to commence over northwest India from May 7 and over central India from May 8. Heatwave conditions are likely over north Madhya Maharashtra on May 5, over Rajasthan between May 7-9, over south Haryana, Delhi, southwest Uttar Pradesh, Madhya Pradesh and Vidarbha on May 8 and 9.

3.title: Woman found alive almost 6 days after China building collapse
3.article_body: A woman was pulled alive from the rubble of a building that partially collapsed on April 29 in China's Changsha, state media reported on Thursday. Officials said at least five people have died as a result of the collapse. Authorities have arrested nine people, including the owner of the building, on suspicion of ignoring building codes or committing other violations.

4.title: Rahul, Priyanka should visit Raj & witness violent incidents: BJP leader
4.article_body: BJP state in-charge Arun Singh has asked Congress leader Rahul Gandhi to return from Nepal at the soonest and visit Rajasthan following Jodhpur violence. "He (Rahul) and Priyanka Gandhi should visit the state and witness the violent incidents," Singh added. "He should instruct the state government to maintain law and order and not indulge in appeasement politics," Singh stated.

5.title: 2 open fire in Bhajanpura, Delhi Police personnel's husband injured
5.article_body: Delhi Police has said that the preliminary investigation into the Bhajanpura firing on Wednesday revealed that two people opened fire upon another duo over personal enmity. Two people, including a Delhi Police personnel's husband, were injured in the firing. The prime suspect was having personal enmity with one of the victims on the issue of a love affair, police added.

6.title: Tomato prices soar in Bengaluru amid supply shortage
6.article_body: The rates of vegetables in Bengaluru have increased due to rise in temperature and the price of tomatoes has almost reached ₹50-65/kilogram. "The production of tomatoes in neighbouring Maharashtra has dropped over last few weeks and hence, the supply has been hit," an official said. The prices of beans and cauliflowers have also increased due to a shortage in supply.

7.title: It compelled me to do things I had never done before: Ayushmann on 'Anek'
7.article_body: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana said his character 'Joshua' in the upcoming film 'Anek' "compelled" him to do things he had never done before, physically and mentally. "I gave this role my best shot to bring life to everything director Anubhav Sinha envisioned for the film," added Ayushmann. Discussing 'Anek', Anubhav termed it as his "most challenging" film so far.

8.title: If DC lose against SRH, their campaign might derail: Ajay Jadeja
8.article_body: Ex-India batter Ajay Jadeja said DC's match against SRH on Thursday is crucial for the Rishabh Pant-led side as their campaign might derail if they lose the game. "They've played one game lesser than other franchises, but have only eight points...this is a hugely significant moment for DC," he added. DC have won four of their nine games so far.

9.title: RSS, BJP planned to incite riots in Jodhpur, Karauli: Rajasthan CM
9.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Thursday said that the RSS and BJP were planning to incite riots in Karauli, Jodhpur and Ramgarh. "They (RSS and BJP) are setting agenda…We took timely action and due to that only small incidents occurred but we've arrested culprits and won't spare anyone," Gehlot added. "We will not allow violence in the state," Gehlot stated.

10.title: Shah flags off boat ambulance at BSF's floating outpost in Bengal
10.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Thursday flagged off a boat ambulance at a floating BSF outpost, which he inaugurated, in West Bengal. Shah is on a two-day visit to the state in which he is scheduled to attend various events. He was received at the Kolkata airport by BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari and MoS Home Nisith Pramanik.

11.title: Can't afford US anti-submarine helicopters: Taiwan
11.article_body: Taiwan on Thursday signalled that it has abandoned a plan to buy advanced new anti-submarine warfare helicopters from the US, saying, "The price is too high, beyond the scope of our country's ability." Taiwan is currently undertaking a military modernisation programme to improve its capabilities to fend off any Chinese attack. China claims democratically-governed Taiwan as its own territory.

12.title: I tell Arjun I want to grow old with him, I know he's my man: Malaika
12.article_body: Speaking about her boyfriend-actor Arjun Kapoor, actress Malaika Arora said they are at a place where they think about 'what next'. "We'd love to see a future together and see where we can take it from here," she added. "I...tell him...'I want to grow old with you'. We'll figure out the rest, but I know he's my man," Malaika said.

13.title: FIR against e-commerce site for selling abortion kits without prescription
13.article_body: The Food and Drug Administration (FDA) has registered a case against an e-commerce website for selling abortion kits without a prescription. A food inspector at FDA placed an order for medical termination of pregnancy (MTP) pill on Amazon without providing a doctor's prescription and received the delivery after a few days. The FDA also found discrepancy in the seller ID.

14.title: NDMC seals 14 unlicensed meat shops, seizes 500 kg of meat in Delhi
14.article_body: North Delhi Municipal Corporation (NDMC) on Wednesday sealed 14 unlicensed meat shops and seized around 500 kg of meat in Delhi. Out of this, 10 shops were sealed in the City-Sadar Paharganj zone, three in Narela zone and one in Rohini zone. "The goal was to maintain public health standards as, during summer, eatables spoil easily," an NDMC official said.

15.title: Williamson has to work on his batting, it's a massive concern: Chawla
15.article_body: Cricketer-commentator Piyush Chawla said SRH captain Kane Williamson needs to work on his batting, adding that his performances with the bat are a "massive concern". "Williamson is a player around whom the entire [SRH] batting unit revolves," stated Chawla. Williamson has scored 195 runs in IPL 2022 so far at a strike rate of 99.48.

16.title: 35 passengers escape unhurt after bus catches fire in Nagpur
16.article_body: As many as 35 passengers escaped unhurt after a bus caught fire near the Reserve Bank square in Maharashtra's Nagpur on Thursday, a fire official said. The blaze started from the engine side, following which the passengers quickly got down from the bus, the official added. The bus, run by the civic body, was going to Khaparkheda, the official stated.

17.title: Sedition law should not be struck down: Centre tells Supreme Court
17.article_body: The sedition law should not be struck down but there is a need for guidelines, Centre told the Supreme Court. Attorney General KK Venugopal argued that a law may not become invalid just because it's been misused. Meanwhile, Kapil Sibal, the lawyer representing petitioners, invoked Mahatma Gandhi saying, "Mahatma said it is a right to create disaffection against the government."

18.title: Woman dragged by car as she tries to intervene between 2 arguing drivers in Delhi
18.article_body: A woman was allegedly dragged and slapped by two men in a car in Delhi's Amar Colony. The woman reportedly tried to intervene in an argument taking place between two drivers when the incident took place. One of the accused was arrested by the police and identified as 25-year-old Udayvir Singh, a resident of Faridabad.

19.title: Not concerned about Jadeja's form: CSK head coach Stephen Fleming
19.article_body: CSK head coach Stephen Fleming has said he's not concerned about all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja's form in IPL 2022. "When you are batting at number five or six, you don't get a lot of time to get the tempo or rhythm right," explained Fleming. So far, Jadeja has scored 116 runs in 10 games. He was dismissed for 3(5) vs RCB.

20.title: Klopp's big chance to get revenge: Wenger on Liverpool-Madrid CL final
20.article_body: Discussing the Champions League final between Liverpool and Real Madrid, ex-Arsenal manager Arsene Wenger said, "This is [Liverpool manager] Jurgen Klopp's big chance to get...revenge [for] the 2018 CL final." Madrid defeated Liverpool 3-1 in the final of the 2018 edition of the Champions League. Real Madrid beat Manchester City 6-5 on aggregate in their Champions League semi-final this edition.

21.title: Heard breaks down in court, says 'When Depp slapped me for 1st time, it changed my life'
21.article_body: Actress Amber Heard broke down in the court while testifying in her ex-husband's Johnny Depp's defamation trial against her. Amber alleged Depp slapped her for the first time in 2012 after she had asked him about his tattoo. "I'd never been hit like that. He slapped me for no reason. I'll never forget it, it changed my life," Heard added.

22.title: Salman bhai played the perfect host, he was last to leave: Aayush on Eid party
22.article_body: Actor Aayush Sharma said his brother-in-law, Salman Khan, was the perfect host at the Eid party, which was hosted by the former and his wife Arpita Khan. "Salman bhai wanted to do it in a grand way and suggested...we host it at our home," he added. "He took care of...the guests...In fact, he was the last to leave," Aayush said.

23.title: Delhi to see partly cloudy skies, thunder and lightning today: IMD
23.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted partly cloudy skies with possibility of thunder and lightning in Delhi today. According to IMD, the maximum temperature is likely to settle around 38°C today. Though western disturbances recently brought relief to Northwest India, the maximum temperature is likely to rise by three to four degrees during the next three days, IMD said.

24.title: Men, boys being raped by Russian soldiers in Ukraine
24.article_body: Russian soldiers in Ukraine have been allegedly raping men and boys, United Nations and Ukrainian officials said. "It's hard for women and girls to report rape because of stigma amongst other reasons, but it's often even harder for men and boys to report," Special Representative of the Secretary-General on Sexual Violence in Conflict, Pramila Patten, said.

25.title: He will have no place even here: Lalu on Prashant Kishor's return to Bihar
25.article_body: Reacting to poll strategist Prashant Kishor's announcement that he will "start from Bihar", RJD chief Lalu Prasad Yadav said that he has come back to Bihar as people everywhere else have sent him back. He will have no place even here, he added. On May 2, Kishor tweeted, "Time to go to the Real Masters."

26.title: Railways to run its first 'Bharat Gaurav' train on June 21
26.article_body: Railways will run its first 'Bharat Gaurav' train on June 21, which would include a stop at Nepal's Janakpur, the Railways said. The train will take people on an 18-day tour covering prominent places associated with life of Lord Ram. The first stop of the train will be in Ayodhya. The price of tour package starts from ₹62,370 per person.

27.title: Prashant Kishor announces 3,000-km Bihar 'padyatra', says no party for now
27.article_body: Political strategist Prashant Kishor on Thursday said that he will carry out a 3,000-kilometre 'padyatra' in Bihar beginning October 2 amid speculations that he is going to form a new political party. However, Kishor said that he is not going to form a political party as of now. "I am going to talk to around 17,000-18,000 people," he added.

28.title: Robbers tamper with ATM, escape with cash in Pune; police launch hunt
28.article_body: Two unidentified suspects allegedly tampered with the sensor of the cash dispenser at an ATM kiosk in Pune's Model Colony and fled with ₹5,000 cash that a user failed to withdraw due to malfunction. Pune City Police have launched a search for the two suspects. The incident reportedly took place on April 27 between 11:50 am and 12:20 pm.

29.title: Mumbai's Kokilaben Hospital completes 4,500 robot-assisted surgeries
29.article_body: The Kokilaben Dhirubhai Ambani Hospital has received its third da Vinci Robotic Surgical System and has completed 4,500 robot-assisted surgeries. It has also become the first hospital to have completed 2,600 robot-assisted surgeries for patients with prostate, kidney and urinary bladder cancer. The hospital had introduced the system in June 2012.

30.title: I don't have a chance: Ex-world no. 1 Murray on match against Djokovic
30.article_body: Discussing his upcoming match against world number one Novak Djokovic in the third round of the Madrid Open 2022, former world number one Andy Murray said, "In theory, I should have no chance in the match." "It's a great opportunity for me," added Murray. Murray will face Djokovic for the first time since the Qatar Open final in 2017.

31.title: Man stabbed to death in suspected honour killing case in Hyderabad
31.article_body: A man was stabbed to death by two persons in Hyderabad's Saroornagar on Wednesday in a suspected case of honour killing, police said. The man and his wife, riding a bike, were attacked with an iron rod following which the latter was injured, police added. Two brothers of the deceased man's wife have been identified as the accused.

32.title: 4 kids drown in MP dam, CM announces ₹4 lakh ex-gratia for kin
32.article_body: Four kids, including one boy and three girls, died after drowning in the Machagora dam in Madhya Pradesh's Chhindwara district. Expressing grief over the incident, Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan announced an ex-gratia of ₹4 lakh each to the families of the victims. "I pray for the peace of the innocent children's souls and strength for the family," he tweeted.

33.title: 20 IAS officers among 33 bureaucrats transferred by J&K administration
33.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir administration on Wednesday ordered the transfer of 33 bureaucrats including 20 IAS officers. Divisional commissioner of Jammu and six deputy commissioners are among those transferred with immediate effect. While senior IAS officer Ashok Parmar has been posted as Principal Secretary of Jal Shakti Department, IAS officer Avny Lavasa has been posted as Deputy Commissioner of Jammu.

34.title: Man, out in forest with female friend, killed by tiger in Maha
34.article_body: A 21-year-old man, who was out in the forest with his female friend, was killed by a tiger in Maharashtra's Gadchiroli district on Tuesday. According to a forest official, the couple, riding a two-wheeler, ventured deep into the Ussegaon forest. The tiger suddenly pounced on the victim, identified as Ajit Nakade, and dragged him away, said the official.

35.title: 2 including Nigerian national cheat people of ₹2.75 cr, held by Ahmedabad Police
35.article_body: Two persons, including a 39-year-old Nigerian national from Mumbai, were arrested by the Ahmedabad Cyber Crime Cell for allegedly cheating 13 persons to the tune of ₹2.75 crore in guise of exporting herbal extract. "Their modus operandi was to connect with people on social media and seek their interest in doing business with a fake Poland-based company," an official said.

36.title: He ripped my underwear off, shoved fingers inside me looking for cocaine: Heard on Depp
36.article_body: While testifying in Johnny Depp's defamation trial against her, actress Amber Heard claimed during a weekend getaway in May 2013, the actor sexually abused her. She added that Depp ripped her dress and underwear off and conducted a cavity search to look for cocaine. "He...shoved his fingers inside me...I just stood there staring at the stupid light," Heard said.

37.title: Novak Djokovic knows how to defend his justice: Vladimir Kamelzon
37.article_body: Russian coach Vladimir Kamelzon said world number one Novak Djokovic knows how to defend his justice, adding that Djokovic is a unique person who has his own opinion. "In my eyes, he is the number one player in the history of tennis. He has a special relationship," stated Kamelzon. "Djokovic is the first racket of the world," said Kamelzon.

38.title: Mom says rats nibbled infant's knees in J'khand, probe panel set up
38.article_body: Mother of a girl child who was born on April 29 said that her child's knees had allegedly been nibbled by rats at a hospital in Jharkhand. The infant was rushed to another hospital in critical condition but is stable now. Reports said that a committee to probe the incident has been set up after family's complaints.

39.title: Fan shares pic of Livingstone's 'crocodile' catching style, cricketer says 'My bad habit'
39.article_body: A cricket fan took to Twitter to share a picture of PBKS' Liam Livingstone's catching style, comparing it to a crocodile opening and closing its mouth. "It's the end result that matters...right? It's a bad habit of mine I've always done," the cricketer responded to the fan. "Was Jonty Rhodes okay with this catching technique of yours?" another fan commented.

40.title: Trainees forced to drink human semen with fish sauce by Navy officer in Thailand
40.article_body: A Navy officer in Thailand has been jailed after video footage that allegedly showed him forcing trainee marines to drink human semen mixed with fish sauce surfaced online. The clip was filmed at a naval training camp in Chon Buri's Sattahip district in October but surfaced last week. Senior officials apologised to the trainees and their families for the abuse.

41.title: Bangladeshi girl rescued from prostitution in Andhra Pradesh
41.article_body: A Bangladeshi girl was rescued from prostitution in Andhra Pradesh's Visakhapatnam by the city police on Wednesday. The girl reportedly entered India illegally and stayed in Kolkata for a few days with a person named Munir. He later sent the girl to Visakhapatnam, where two other accused introduced her to prostitution and confined her in a house, police said.

42.title: HC upholds Osmania University decision to deny Rahul Gandhi visit
42.article_body: The Telangana High Court has upheld Hyderabad's Osmania University's decision to deny Congress leader Rahul Gandhi a visit to meet students on May 7. The Congress party had moved the court after the university rejected an application for the visit. Youth leaders of the party had protested against the university's decision, while students affiliated with ABVP and TRS organised counter-protests.

43.title: Without Lomror, RCB wouldn't have reached 173 vs CSK: Sehwag
43.article_body: Praising RCB all-rounder Mahipal Lomror for his performance against CSK, ex-India opener Virender Sehwag said RCB wouldn't have reached 173/8 without the 22-year-old's knock of 42 off 27 deliveries. "It was an important, crucial innings from Lomror. He set the platform for Dinesh Karthik to do his work," added Sehwag. RCB defeated CSK by 13 runs in the game.

44.title: I've never leaked a sex tape, the Kardashians have abused my name: Ray J
44.article_body: Discussing his sex tape featuring then-girlfriend Kim Kardashian, which leaked in 2007, singer Ray J said, "I have never leaked a sex tape in my life." "I have sat in the shadows for over 14 years allowing the Kardashians to...abuse my name, make billions of dollars over a decade and a half talking about a topic I've never...[discussed]," added Ray.

45.title: Let's hope we haven't left it too late and can peak towards the end: Maxwell
45.article_body: After defeating CSK to register their sixth win in IPL 2022, RCB all-rounder Glenn Maxwell said they're going in the right direction and can hopefully peak towards the end of the league stage. "[Hopefully, we can] find a way into the top four...do some damage in the finals," he added. Maxwell dismissed Robin Uthappa and Ambati Rayudu in the match.

46.title: Colombia extradites 'world's most dangerous drug trafficker' to US
46.article_body: Colombia has extradited Dairo Antonio Usuga, alias Otoniel, who'd been the country's most-wanted drug lord before his capture, to the US. He's wanted in America for crimes including drug trafficking, conspiracy and illegally possessing weapons. Colombian President Ivan Duque said Otoniel wasn't only the "world's most dangerous drug trafficker" but also a "murderer" and "abuser of boys and girls".

47.title: Chandigarh resident cheated of ₹4 lakh while trying to update KYC
47.article_body: A Chandigarh resident was cheated of ₹4.34 lakh minutes after he clicked a web link shared on his mobile phone to update KYC details pertaining to his savings bank account. The person who called the victim had introduced himself as a bank representative. The link was shared from a mobile number which was later found registered to a fake identity.

48.title: Been 1 year, it's as painful as 1st day: Nikki on brother's death anniversary
48.article_body: Actress Nikki Tamboli shared a video of her late brother on his first death anniversary and said that the last one year has been the longest for her. "One year has passed since you left...After a year, it is still as painful as the first day...I will always know that I'll never get to hug you again," she wrote.

49.title: NDMC sets up separate registration counters for suspected COVID patients
49.article_body: Amid rise in COVID-19 cases in the national capital, the North Delhi Municipal Corporation (NDMC) has set up separate registration counters for suspected coronavirus patients at its health facilities. In a statement, the NDMC added that it will also "provide one month's advance medicines to patients suffering from chronic diseases". Notably, Delhi reported 1,354 fresh Covid-19 cases on Wednesday.

50.title: Tamil Nadu Governor sends anti-NEET bill for President's approval
50.article_body: After re-enactment of a bill seeking exemption for Tamil Nadu students from the National Entrance-cum-Eligibility Test (NEET), Governor RN Ravi sent the anti-NEET bill to the Centre for President's approval. "Bill will be rejected by the President," state BJP chief K Annamalai said. Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam workers had protested against the Governor for not sending the bill to the President.

51.title: BJP 'hero' in publicity, Cong failed to publicise its work: Ghulam Nabi
51.article_body: Congress leader Ghulam Nabi Azad said that BJP government is a "hero" in publicity and called Congress "zero". "Their (BJP) government is a hero in publicity but we were zero in publicity…completely zero...It's good, I appreciate them and I blame myself, my government and my party that we failed miserably, whatever we did we could not publicise," Azad added.

52.title: Diego Maradona's 'Hand of God' shirt sells for world-record £7.14 million at auction
52.article_body: The shirt that late Argentine legend Diego Maradona wore when he scored 'Hand of God' goal against England in 1986 World Cup sold for a world-record price of £7.14 million at a London auction. It surpasses the previous records for a match-worn jersey and a piece of sports memorabilia. Maradona had also scored 'Goal of the Century' in that match.

53.title: Biometric data for Aadhaar can't be used to identify criminals: UIDAI to Delhi HC
53.article_body: Biometric data collected for Aadhaar cannot be used to identify criminals or solve crimes, the UIDAI has told Delhi High Court. It said that sharing or use of biometric information for purposes other than the generation of the Aadhaar number is "impermissible" under the Aadhaar Act, 2016. It added that it anyway doesn't collect biometric information suitable for forensic purposes.

54.title: 2 arrested with heroin worth ₹3 crore in Nagaland's Kohima
54.article_body: Nagaland Police arrested two persons and allegedly seized 615 gram of heroin from them in Kohima on Wednesday. According to the police, the seized amount of drug is valued at ₹3 crore in the international market. Giving details about the incident, police said, "We have intercepted one suspicious vehicle and recovered 49 packets of suspected heroin."

55.title: Not stepping into someone's shoes: Kiara on comparison with Vidya in 'Bhool...'
55.article_body: Kiara Advani said she's "not stepping into someone's shoes" in 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' after her performance is being compared to Vidya Balan's performance in 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa'. Kiara added they've tried to retain the essence of the original film and some elements including Manjulika's name. "This isn't a psychological thriller but a horror-comedy. There's a layer of black magic," she said.

56.title: Russia resorting to missile terrorism to spread fear: Ukraine
56.article_body: Amid intense bombardment by Russian forces, Ukraine has accused them of using  "missile terrorism". Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba said that Russia is "resorting to the missile terrorism tactics in order to spread fear across Ukraine." Meanwhile, the Russian military said that it used missiles to destroy power facilities at five railway stations across Ukraine.

57.title: US intelligence helped Ukraine kill Russian generals: Report
57.article_body: The US provided Ukraine with intelligence that allowed them to target and kill many of the Russian generals who've died in the ongoing war, The New York Times reported citing senior American officials. The report said Ukraine combined location and other details from US with their own intelligence to conduct artillery strikes and other attacks that have killed Russian officers.

58.title: Taliban force Shias to break Eid fast early: Report
58.article_body: The Taliban reportedly forced Shia Muslims in Afghanistan to break their fasts before the Shia announcement of Eid. They also barred Shia mosques from holding Eid prayers, said reports. "Taliban forces prohibited dozens of Shia mosques from holding Eid prayers…Shia activists reported this violation of religious rights in Herat and Kabul," local journalist Massoud Hossaini said on Twitter.

59.title: Internet services suspended in Bhilwara for 24 hours after attack on 2 people
59.article_body: Internet services were suspended in the Bhilwara city in Rajasthan for 24 hours, District Collector Ashish Modi said on Thursday. This comes after two people were attacked by unknown persons when they were having food in the Sanganer area on Wednesday night. "Their bike was also set ablaze. We are investigating the matter," Modi added.

60.title: IT firm offers free matchmaking service to staff, hike on getting married in TN
60.article_body: An IT company headquartered in Madurai offers its employees free matchmaking service and a hike when they get married. "Employees treat me like a brother and several of them are from villages, with either aged parents or lacking a proper outlook of the world and unable to find the right match," CEO of Sri Mookambika Infosolutions MP Selvaganesh said.

61.title: Russia practises simulated nuclear-capable missile strikes
61.article_body: Russia on Wednesday said its forces practised simulated nuclear-capable missile strikes in the western enclave of Kaliningrad, amid the war in Ukraine. The forces practised single and multiple strikes at targets imitating launchers of missile systems, airfields, protected infrastructure, military equipment and command posts of a mock enemy, the Russian Defence Ministry added.

62.title: Real Madrid pull off comeback to defeat Man City, reach Champions League final
62.article_body: Real Madrid entered the Champions League final after defeating Manchester City 6-5 on aggregate in the semi-final. In the semi-final's second leg on Wednesday night, Madrid trailed 1-0 and 5-3 on aggregate heading into the 90th minute when Rodrygo scored twice to send the game to extra time. Karim Benzema then scored an extra-time penalty to win the tie.

63.title: India has seen communal tensions since 7th century: BJP leader CT Ravi
63.article_body: BJP leader CT Ravi on Wednesday said communal tension is not new in India. "It started from the first attack on India in the 7th century, not from today," Ravi said. "Some people try to create communal tension. There are some intolerant faiths," he added. His remarks came following recent communal clashes reported from across the country.

64.title: There is a swimming pool in PM Modi's plane: Adhir Chowdhury
64.article_body: Reacting to BJP's criticism on Rahul Gandhi's Nepal tour, Congress leader Adhir Chowdhury said that there is a swimming pool in PM Narendra Modi's new plane, reported Times Now citing media reports. Chowdhury also claimed that PM Modi bought two planes worth ₹13,000 crore and used to take bath in the pool while travelling to foreign countries, the report said.

65.title: 150 MNS workers arrested in Nashik for allegedly creating communal tension
65.article_body: As many as 150 workers from the Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) were arrested in Nashik for allegedly creating communal tension in the district, local police officials informed. The arrests have been made as part of preventive actions taken to maintain law and order in the state, following MNS chief Raj Thackeray's appeal to play Hanuman Chalisa on loudspeakers outside mosques.

66.title: India has sufficient stock of wheat to sustain for a year: Centre
66.article_body: India currently has more than the required quantity of wheat in stocks to sustain for a year, Sudhanshu Pandey, Secretary, Department of Food and Public Distribution, said. Due to an increase in the market prices and higher demand by the private players, both for domestic and export purposes, farmers are getting a good price for the wheat, Sudhanshu added.

67.title: Couldn't sleep during Love Hostel, broke down on set; spoke to therapist: Sanya
67.article_body: Actress Sanya Malhotra said that her character from 'Love Hostel' was emotionally overwhelming for her. "During the shoot, I remember not being able to sleep at night and feeling uneasy all day. In fact, I remember breaking down on the set of the film one day. That's when I spoke to my therapist," she added.

68.title: 'Jayeshbhai' and I are both accidental heroes: Ranveer on 'Jayeshbhai...'
68.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh said he and his character 'Jayeshbhai' in his upcoming film 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar' are both "accidental heroes". "There are several parallels between my life and 'Jayeshbhai's' life. In playing 'Jayeshbhai', I was able to tap into my own...experiences," added Ranveer. "With the odds stacked against yourself, you turn to the power that love gives you," stated Ranveer.

69.title: Mumbai man held for 18th time over sexual abuse, was addicted to adult content
69.article_body: A 30-year-old Mumbai-based man was arrested for allegedly sexually assaulting a minor girl who was playing in her housing society. The police found that the accused had already been arrested 17 times before in cases of molestation and kidnapping. The accused got addicted to watching adult content when he was younger, after which he started molesting women, the police said.

70.title: A journey from ₹1000 to ₹30 lacs, meet Avinash Koneru: Adda52
70.article_body: Adda52 announced Avinash Koneru as the winner of its Big Millions Tournament. The brand revealed that the Bangalore-based IT professional qualified through a ₹1,100 buy-in satellite tournament and received a sum of ₹31,63,652 from the prize pool of ₹2 crore, adding that he is the true epitome of what one can achieve with continuous efforts and dedication.

71.title: Journalist attacked with iron rod, robbed of cash in Punjab's Zirakpur
71.article_body: A media person, Alok Verma, who works in a vernacular daily published from Panchkula, was attacked with an iron rod by unknown bikers on Tuesday in Punjab's Zirakpur. The attackers, who followed him while he was going home, reportedly hit him on the head with the rod and took away his cash and cell phone. Verma has been hospitalised.

72.title: BSF discovers suspected tunnel near Indo-Pak border in J&K
72.article_body: The BSF on Wednesday detected a suspected tunnel near India-Pakistan border in Jammu and Kashmir's Samba district. A small opening was found near the fencing in the Samba area during patrolling by BSF personnel at around 5:30 pm, according to reports quoting sources. The officials said almost a fortnight ago, two Jaish-e-Mohammed suicide bombers, who infiltrated from Pakistan, were killed.

73.title: There have been many reasons: Mrunal on Jersey's box office failure
73.article_body: Speaking about Jersey's poor performance at the box office, actress Mrunal Thakur said that it's disappointing. "There have been many external reasons. But yes, one does tend to feel low. Anyway, we will work harder next time," she added. Mrunal said she has "no idea" what audiences want, especially after the success of South Indian films like 'RRR' and 'Pushpa'.

74.title: Railway collects ₹2.4 crore as fines for ticketless travel in Pune
74.article_body: Pune Railway Division collected ₹2.47 crore in the month of April as fines from 36,579 ticketless travellers, its highest monthly collection. Another 101 passengers were fined ₹46,629 for travelling in an improper way, including travelling while being drunk. "Passengers unable to pay fine will be arrested by the railway police," Manoj Jhawar, spokesperson for Pune Railway Division, said.

75.title: India reports 3,275 new COVID-19 cases, 55 deaths in 24 hours
75.article_body: India has reported 3,275 COVID-19 cases, 3,010 recoveries and 55 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 3,205 COVID-19 cases and 31 deaths. Active cases in India stand at 19,719, while the death toll has risen to 5,23,975.

76.title: Virat Kohli's aggressive celebration after MS Dhoni's dismissal goes viral, fans react
76.article_body: A video of RCB batter Virat Kohli's aggressive celebration after CSK captain MS Dhoni's dismissal in their IPL 2022 match went viral. Reacting to the celebration, a fan tweeted, "Can't match the aggression he shows while wearing RCB jersey." "Dhoni fans taking their frustration out on Kohli's routine celebration is peak Twitter," wrote another.

77.title: Fake Whatsapp account created in Lok Sabha Speaker's name, 3 arrested
77.article_body: A fake WhatsApp account was created in Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla's name following which three persons were arrested by the Odisha Police. "Some miscreants have created a fake account in my name with profile photo and sending messages to MPs...Matter has been reported to authorities...Please ignore calls/messages from these and other numbers and inform my office," the Speaker tweeted.

78.title: I've been trying to improve my sequencing: Harshal on 3/35 vs CSK
78.article_body: RCB pacer Harshal Patel, who was named Man of the Match for his performance against CSK, has said he has been trying to improve his sequencing in the ongoing IPL season. "When people are waiting for the slower balls, my hard length balls and my yorkers are released," he added. Harshal dismissed Moeen Ali, Ravindra Jadeja and Dwaine Pretorius.

79.title: BMC to make EV charging points mandatory in new buildings across Mumbai
79.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) is planning to make electric vehicle (EV) charging points compulsory in new buildings that would come up in Mumbai. "To encourage developers to install charging stations...offering incentives is also being discussed," a BMC official said. Moreover, the BMC is also planning to set up charging stations at 28 locations in municipal properties, he added.

80.title: He could make Twitter 'worse', but we should not underestimate him: Gates on Musk
80.article_body: At an event hosted by The Wall Street Journal, Bill Gates said Elon Musk actually could make Twitter "worse". "That's not his track record. I mean his track record with Tesla and SpaceX is pretty mind blowing...I kind of doubt that will happen this time, but we should have an open mind and never underestimate Elon," Gates added.

81.title: What let us down against RCB was batsmanship: MS Dhoni
81.article_body: CSK captain MS Dhoni said their batsmanship let them down against RCB as they lost by 13 runs on Wednesday. "When you're chasing...you have to...see what really the situation is demanding rather than playing your shots. [Our] shot selection could have been better towards the end," he added. RCB posted 173/8 and then restricted CSK to 160/8 to win.

82.title: I am not considered for any role by most casting directors: Inaamulhaq
82.article_body: Actor Inaamulhaq who featured in Akshay Kumar-starrer 'Jolly LLB 2' which released in 2017, said he is not considered for "any role" by most casting directors. "I did 10 films in the last 10 years," added Inaamulhaq. "For [my film] 'Nakkash', I got a few awards but nothing major as there's a different rule for actors like us," stated Inaamulhaq.

83.title: Dalit groom forced by villagers to get down from horse in U’khand
83.article_body: A Dalit groom was allegedly forced by some villagers to dismount a horse at his wedding in Uttarakhand’s Almora. The groom’s father filed a complaint with the SDM stating that villagers threatened to kill his son if he did not get down from the horse on Monday. The district administration has ordered a probe to verify the complaint, officials said.

84.title: Viral video shows man selling drugs on Punjab railway track, 7 held
84.article_body: Police have arrested seven people after a video of drug addicts crowding around a man openly selling drugs on a rail track in Faridkot went viral. "Taking immediate action, the accused has been arrested under relevant sections. Faridkot Police is fully committed in its fight against drugs," Faridkot SSP said. Navjot Singh Sidhu had shared the video on Twitter.

85.title: School bus catches fire after falling in burning field in Punjab, 2 injured
85.article_body: Two students were injured after a school bus caught fire after overturning and falling into a burning wheat field in Punjab's Gurdaspur on Wednesday. The incident took place at around 1:30 pm when children were being taken back home from school. FIR stated that smoke from field created zero visibility, during which, driver lost control and bus went off road.

86.title: Patiala law university declared containment zone as 60 students test COVID +ve
86.article_body: Rajiv Gandhi National University of Law (RGNUL) in Punjab's Patiala has been declared a containment zone after 60 students tested positive for COVID-19 in the last two days. "Those positive have mild symptoms and are isolated in separate blocks," Patiala DC Sakshi Sawhney said. The district administration has asked the university to get the hostels vacated by May 10.

87.title: There was zero publicity for Special OPS, hoardings were pulled down: Neeraj
87.article_body: Recalling how difficult it was to promote 'Special OPS' due to the outbreak of COVID-19, filmmaker Neeraj Pandey said the show solely survived on word of mouth. "There was zero marketing and publicity for 'Special OPS'," he added. "All our press meets were cancelled. The MCD had taken off all the hoardings to put up COVID-19 awareness posters," Neeraj said.

88.title: 34-yr-old man found dead in Chandigarh; drug overdose suspected
88.article_body: A 34-year-old daily wage labourer, who worked as a plumber, was found dead near Burail in Chandigarh under mysterious circumstances on Wednesday. Police are suspecting drug overdose behind the death, as a used syringe was found near the body. According to his family, the deceased was a drug addict. His viscera samples have been sent for forensic examination, police said.

89.title: BMC headquarters lit in purple and blue to raise awareness for Huntington's disease
89.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) illuminated its headquarters in purple and blue lights on Wednesday to raise awareness about Huntington's disease. The disease is an incurable genetic ailment that affects the brain and is caused due to  production of a disease-causing huntingtin protein. "We express solidarity with patients and families that are affected by it," the BMC said.

90.title: Loudspeakers should be banned: Minorities Commission chief
90.article_body: National Commission for Minorities chief Iqbal Singh Lalpura said that loudspeakers should be banned at religious and other public places.  "Azaan must be there. But there is also an issue of noise pollution…Loudspeakers should be banned whether they are at religious places or markets, restaurants or anywhere else," he said. The Commission is there to protect minorities, he added.

91.title: GMR Group to run Hyderabad airport for 30 more years till 2068
91.article_body: GMR Hyderabad International Airport Limited, a step-down subsidiary of GMR Infrastructure Limited, will run Rajiv Gandhi International Airport for another 30 years till 2068. This comes after the Ministry of Civil Aviation extended the terms of the Concession Agreement from March 23, 2038 up to March 22, 2068. The extension is in terms of the agreement dated December 20, 2004.

92.title: Nepali singer tweets pic with Rahul Gandhi, says 'such humble, simple person'
92.article_body: Nepali singer Saraswoti Khatri has tweeted a photo with Rahul Gandhi. They were attending former CNN correspondent Sumnima Udas' wedding. Khatri wrote, "Music has the power to bring all people together. I had an honor to sing few songs for honorable member of Indian Parliament Mr Rahul Gandhi ji yesterday evening. I found him such humble & simple person."

93.title: Were always short of money while looking for house, struggled for yrs: Supriya
93.article_body: Actress Supriya Pathak said when she and husband Pankaj Kapur were looking to buy a house, they were always a little short of money. "My father-in-law...[said] we must not go for a rented house...It's better to pay instalments for a home loan...When we took loan, whatever money could have gone into rent, we paid that much in instalments," she added.

94.title: 9, including 2 minors, held for kidnapping & killing man in Bengaluru
94.article_body: Police have arrested nine people, including two minors, for allegedly kidnapping and killing a 33-year-old man in Bengaluru. Police suspect that one of the prime accused was in a relationship with the deceased's wife, which reportedly led to the murder. The victim, who was suffering from asthma, was reportedly locked inside a luggage carrier and died due to breathlessness.

95.title: Woman proposes to boyfriend in stands during RCB-CSK match, pics go viral
95.article_body: A woman proposed to her boyfriend in the stands during the RCB-CSK match at the MCA Stadium in Pune on Wednesday. Reacting to it, former India opener Wasim Jaffer tweeted, "Smart girl proposing [to] an RCB fan. If he can stay loyal to RCB, he can definitely stay loyal to his partner...Well done and a good day to propose."

96.title: Mumbai's Dharavi reports 1st COVID-19 case since March 17
96.article_body: Mumbai's Dharavi reported one new case of COVID-19 on Wednesday, its first infection since March 17, a Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) official said. With this, Dharavi's overall count of COVID-19 cases reached 8,653, while death toll stood at 419, the official added. This comes as Mumbai reported 117 new coronavirus cases on Wednesday, its highest single-day tally since February 25.

97.title: Fire continues for 9th day at Delhi's Bhalswa landfill
97.article_body: Firefighters on Wednesday continued to douse the fire at Delhi's Bhalswa landfill, nine days after a massive fire broke out at the site last Tuesday. This is one of the longest operations as most fires, including ones at landfills, are doused in two-five days, Delhi Fire Services said. "The land is simply unapproachable...mounds are tall and unstable," an official said.

98.title: India calls for 'immediate end to hostilities' in Ukraine in joint statement with France
98.article_body: In a joint statement, India and France have called for "immediate end to hostilities" in Ukraine. "Both countries unequivocally condemned the fact that civilians have been killed in Ukraine, and called for an immediate cessation of hostilities in order for the two sides to come together...to put an immediate end to the suffering of the people," the statement read.

99.title: Mumbai doctor loses ₹1 lakh while buying discounted clothes online
99.article_body: A Mumbai doctor was cheated of ₹99,994 while purchasing discounted clothes online. Upon not receiving his order, he contacted the site's customer care but got no response. He later got a call from a person who identified himself as the company's executive and asked him to share details. The complainant later noticed four transactions worth ₹9,999 and two worth ₹20,000.

100.title: 2 dead, 1 injured after car hits electric pole on Palm Beach Road
100.article_body: While one person was grievously injured, two others died after their car hit the safety barrier and an electric pole on Navi Mumbai's Palm Beach Road on May 4. The survivor, Nitin Mathew, has been admitted to a hospital and his condition is serious. Since Mathew isn't in a condition to talk, we couldn't get much details, police said.

101.title: Father booked for negligence after son dies in bike accident near Panvel
101.article_body: A 36-year-old father has reportedly been booked for negligence after his five-year-old son died in a bike accident near Panvel. The man was riding his bike and his son was sitting on the bike's petrol tank when it collided head-on with a wall on a road's side. After the collision, the bike fell outside a bridge, causing injuries to them.

102.title: US Federal Reserve raises interest rates by 50 bps in the biggest hike in 22 years
102.article_body: The US Federal Reserve System on Wednesday raised its benchmark overnight interest rate by 50 bps, citing elevated inflation. It's the second hike in two months by the US Fed and the largest increase since 2000, which brings the key rate to a range of 0.75% to 1%. US inflation reached 6.6% last month, the highest point in four decades.

103.title: RCB defeat CSK to end their 3-match losing streak, jump to 4th on points table
103.article_body: RCB defeated CSK by 13 runs in their IPL 2022 match at the MCA Stadium in Pune on Wednesday to end their three-match losing streak. With the win, RCB jumped to the fourth position on the points table. Mahipal Lomror top-scored for RCB with 42(27), while RCB bowling all-rounder Harshal Patel took three wickets in the match.

104.title: Identify and remove defects in power distribution: UP Energy Minister
104.article_body: Energy Minister AK Sharma made a spot inspection of the 33KV substation in Vibhuti Khand and issued instructions to ensure that the power supply was not disrupted because of avoidable local faults. He asked the officials to identify and remove deficiencies and minimise the occurrence of local power breakdowns. The preventive maintenance, he said, was the key to the problem.

105.title: Northeast India is natural gateway to Southeast Asia & beyond: Prez
105.article_body: President Ram Nath Kovind on Wednesday said India's Northeast region is the natural gateway to Southeast Asia and beyond. "Northeast has immense inherent strengths. What it offers in terms of tourism, horticulture, handloom and sports is often unique," President Kovind said. He added that efforts are now required to be made to bring Northeast at par with industrially-advanced states.

106.title: Delhivery sets IPO price band at ₹462-487 to raise ₹5,235 cr
106.article_body: The price band for the upcoming IPO of logistics startup Delhivery will be ₹462-487/share, valuing the company at ₹35,283 crore. The IPO will open for subscription between May 11 and 13. It aims to raise ₹4,000 crore via fresh issue of shares and ₹1,235 crore through an offer for sale.  Delhivery had earlier planned to raise ₹7,460 crore.

107.title: Local languages' promotion responsibility of society, govt: President
107.article_body: While addressing the 61st annual conference of the Bodo Sahitya Sabha in Assam, President Ram Nath Kovind on Wednesday said that it's the responsibility of society and government to promote local languages. The President said that to keep any literature alive and relevant, the participation of the younger generation is very important, which is why young writers should be encouraged.

108.title: LinkedIn to pay female workers in US $1.75 mn over pay gap claims
108.article_body: LinkedIn has agreed to pay $1.75 million in back wages to 686 female workers after the US Labour Department alleged that they faced "systemic, gender-based pay discrimination". As per the complaint, from 2015 to 2017, women working in engineering, product or marketing roles at two of LinkedIn's offices were paid less than their male counterparts. LinkedIn has denied the allegation.

109.title: Waze paid encounter specialist ₹45 lakh to kill Mansukh Hiren: NIA
109.article_body:
National Investigation Agency (NIA) has stated in its affidavit that suspended Mumbai Police officer Sachin Waze paid ₹45 lakh to encounter specialist Pradeep Sharma to kill Mansukh Hiren.
Mansukh Hiren's body was found in the Mumbra Creek days after his stolen vehicle was found with gelatin sticks near Antilia, the residence of Mukesh Ambani, on February 25, 2021.

110.title: Raids on Chinese firms linked to 'spy' Luo Sang's arrest: Report
110.article_body: The crackdown on Chinese firms like Huawei and Xiaomi by enforcement agencies is linked to the arrest of Chinese national Luo Sang, who is accused of spying for China, ANI reported. The Income Tax Department had caught Sang alias Charlie Peng in raids related to a ₹1,000 crore Hawala network in 2020. Both Huawei and Xiaomi have denied the allegations.

111.title: That woman is unstable: Shatrughan Sinha's son on Pooja Mishra's 'sex scam' claim
111.article_body: Reacting to 'Bigg Boss 5' contestant Pooja Mishra's claim that Shatrughan Sinha and his family traded her in a 'sex scam', son Luv Sinha tweeted, "That woman needs professional help...She's unstable." "I normally don't waste...time responding to...trash...but I think the...editor who approved this story should realise that strong legal action can be taken," he added while tagging a media house.

112.title: Delhi reports 1,354 COVID-19 cases, 1,486 recoveries in last 24 hrs
112.article_body: Delhi reported 1,354 new COVID-19 cases and one related death in the last 24 hours, taking the overall infection tally in the city to 18,88,404. The national capital reported 1,486 recoveries and the active cases stand at 5,853, while the positivity rate is 7.64%. Delhi on Tuesday had reported 1,414 COVID-19 cases and one related death.

113.title: Loudspeaker issue can be fatal for national integration: Lalu Yadav
113.article_body: Former Bihar CM and RJD President Lalu Prasad Yadav has said that the loudspeaker issue can be fatal for the national integration. This is equivalent to division of the nation, he added. "Why are you going towards the mosques? Hanuman Chalisa can be recited in temples. This actually aims at irritating a community," Lalu Prasad Yadav said.

114.title: Myanmar junta court rejects Suu Kyi's plea against 5-yr-jail term
114.article_body: Deposed Myanmar leader Aung San Suu Kyi's appeal against a five-year jail sentence for graft was rejected by a junta court on Wednesday. Suu Kyi was handed the jail term last week after being found guilty of accepting a bribe of cash and gold from a former minister. Notably, she has also been charged with several other corruption cases.

115.title: Siddaramaiah demands judicial probe into alleged K'taka PSI scam
115.article_body: Congress leader and former Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah demanded a judicial probe into the alleged Karnataka police sub-inspector (PSI) recruitment scam worth ₹300 crore. "I am asking the government why they have not suspended or registered an FIR against these officers," Siddaramaiah questioned. He also demanded the dismissal of the higher education minister from the cabinet.

116.title: Have a couple more kids and enjoy love, David Warner jokingly advises Virat Kohli
116.article_body: On being asked what advice he'd give to Virat Kohli over his poor form in initial matches of IPL 2022, DC opener David Warner jokingly said, "Have a couple more kids and enjoy love." He added, "Form is temporary and class is permanent. So you don't lose that. [Bad form] happens to every single player in the world."

117.title: Another sign that pandemic isn't done with us: WHO on 2 new sub-variants of Omicron
117.article_body: The World Health Organization (WHO) has said that the South African scientists who identified Omicron variant of COVID-19 late last year have now reported two more Omicron sub-variants, BA.4 and BA.5. "This is another sign that the [COVID-19] pandemic is not done with us, and there are some clear takeaways," WHO chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus said on Wednesday.

118.title: I'm passionately excited about Abhinav Bindra's biopic: Anil Kapoor
118.article_body: Anil Kapoor, speaking about the biopic of Olympic gold-medalist Abhinav Bindra, has said, "That's the next thing that I'm...passionately excited about." "We are...in pre-production because that film needs a lot of planning," he added. Anil's son Harsh Varrdhan Kapoor will reportedly be playing Abhinav in the film. "I'm sure...Harsh is also looking forward to starting that film," Anil stated.

119.title: Odisha doubles ex-gratia for relatives of deceased jawans to ₹10 lakh
119.article_body: The Odisha government on Wednesday doubled the ex-gratia for the relatives of deceased jawans killed during wars and anti-terrorist operations from ₹5 lakh to ₹10 lakh. In February 2019, ex-gratia of ₹10 lakh was announced by CM Naveen Patnaik for the families of Central Reserve Police Force jawans, who were killed in a terror attack in J&K's Pulwama.

120.title: European style roads in Delhi will be a reality soon: Sisodia
120.article_body: Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia said European style roads will soon be a reality in Delhi as he reviewed the streetscaping projects on Wednesday. This effort of the Kejriwal Government will also decongest city roads and enhance mobility along with making them beautiful, he said. He further added that the government is also developing facilities for pedestrians.

121.title: India may curb wheat exports as record heat damages crop: Report
121.article_body: India, which experienced its hottest March on record, is considering restricting wheat exports as severe heatwaves have damaged crops, Bloomberg reported. As per its source, the government might boost domestic supply by setting a minimum export price. This comes as the Food Ministry on Wednesday reduced its estimate of wheat output this season to 105 million tonnes.

122.title: Mist Cooling System installed in Odisha amid heatwave: Indian Railways
122.article_body: Mist Cooling System has been installed at a railway station in Odisha's Sambalpur to help the commuters beat the heat amid the heatwave, the Ministry of Railways tweeted. The tweet showed a video of how the cooling system works. Several states including Jharkhand, Uttar Pradesh, Rajasthan, Madhya Pradesh, Punjab and Karnataka have been witnessing heatwave.

123.title: Sri Lanka's economic crisis will last for at least 2 more yrs: Minister
123.article_body: Sri Lanka's Finance Minister Ali Sabry on Wednesday said that the country's ongoing economic crisis will last for at least two more years, according to a report. Sabry said, "People should know the truth...We won't be able to resolve this crisis in two years, but the actions we take today will determine how much longer this problem will drag."

124.title: PM Modi welcomed by Indian diaspora on his arrival in Paris
124.article_body: PM Narendra Modi was on Wednesday welcomed by the Indian community in Paris. PM Modi arrived in the French capital on the third and final leg of his visit to three European countries. He will meet French President Emmanuel Macron during his visit. PM Modi earlier visited Germany and Denmark.

125.title: Made me uncomfortable: Palak on being clicked with Ibrahim Ali Khan
125.article_body: Palak Tiwari, who was recently clicked with actor Saif Ali Khan's son Ibrahim Ali Khan, has said it was something new for her. "I was a little taken aback and it made me a little uncomfortable," she stated. Earlier, Palak had said she and Ibrahim are just friends and all the rumours about them being a couple are a "conjecture".

126.title: Refrain from destabilising actions: US to North Korea on missile launch
126.article_body: United States condemned North Korea's ballistic missile launch on Wednesday and urged Pyongyang to refrain from further destabilising actions, the US military said. The US, however, said that this event does not pose an immediate threat to US personnel or its allies, adding, "We'll continue to monitor the situation." The launch reportedly marks North Korea's 14th weapons test this year.

127.title: LIC IPO booked 67% on day 1; policyholder share subscribed 1.99 times
127.article_body: LIC IPO was subscribed 67% on the first day of bidding on Wednesday, with investors bidding for 10.8 crore shares, compared with the total 16.2 crore shares on offer. While the policyholders' share was subscribed 1.99 times, employees' portion was subscribed 1.17 times. "The demand seems to be quite good...RBI rate hike...will have a limited impact," an expert told Reuters.

128.title: Jacqueline replaced by Nora Fatehi in Pawan Kalyan's film: Report
128.article_body: Actress Jacqueline Fernandez has reportedly been replaced by Nora Fatehi in Actor Pawan Kalyan's Telugu film 'Hari Hara Veera Mallu'. "Because Nora is a good dancer and has impressive facial expressions, she is considered suitable for the role," a source said. Nora will reportedly be portraying the role of Roshanara Begum in the film, who was Mughal emperor Aurangzeb's sister.

129.title: Russia responsible for ties with Japan now: PM Kishida after entry ban
129.article_body: Japan PM Fumio Kishida, who has been banned along with 62 other Japanese citizens from entering Russia, said that Russia is now fully responsible for state of bilateral ties. Russia cited "unacceptable rhetoric" against Moscow as the reason for the ban. Notably, the ban came in response to Japan's sanctions against Russian President Vladimir Putin, other officials over Ukraine's invasion.

130.title: Curfew in Jodhpur imposed after clashes extended till May 6 midnight
130.article_body: The district administration in Rajasthan's Jodhpur has extended the curfew till midnight of May 6 (Friday). The curfew was imposed in 10 police station areas on Tuesday after communal clashes broke out on Monday night. Several people, including police personnel, were injured during the violence in the district.

131.title: Kim Kardashian was gifted a box containing Monroe's hair before Met Gala, reveals video
131.article_body: Kim Kardashian, who wore the custom-made Jean Louis gown that was worn by Marilyn Monroe during her performance for ex-US President John F Kennedy in 1962 at this year's Met Gala, was gifted a box containing a lock of Monroe's hair. She got the present during a dress fitting, revealed a video shared by 'Ripley's Believe It or Not!'.

132.title: 4 men drag teen girl out of auto and tear her clothes in UP, post video online
132.article_body: A teenaged girl travelling with her aunt in an auto-rickshaw was allegedly pulled out of the vehicle and molested by four youths in Uttar Pradesh's Gonda recently. They dragged her to roadside bushes where they tore her clothes and molested her and later posted the incident's video online, police said. A search has been launched to nab the accused.

133.title: Google hires ex-civil servant Archana Gulati as India policy head: Report
133.article_body: Google has hired former civil services officer Archana Gulati as its public policy head in India, Reuters reported. Gulati, a telecom and competition policy expert who retired voluntarily at Sr. DDG (Additional Secretary Level), has been a financial advisor to the government for over 30 years. Until March 2021, she worked as Joint Secretary for Digital Communications at NITI Aayog.

134.title: Musk plans to take Twitter public again 3 years after buyout: Report
134.article_body: World's richest man Elon Musk, who struck a deal to buy Twitter for $44 billion and to take it private, could take the company public again after a few years, WSJ reported. Musk reportedly told potential investors that he plans to take Twitter public in as little as three years of buying it. Twitter's IPO took place in November 2013.

135.title: India to be official country of honour at Cannes Film Market this year
135.article_body: India will be the official country of honours at the Cannes Film Market this year. It will be for the first time that a country has been honoured and the tradition will continue in the upcoming years. The event will be held from May 17 to May 25. Information and Broadcasting Minister Anurag Thakur will be giving the welcome address.

136.title: Dehradun school reports 16 COVID cases, turned into micro-containment zone
136.article_body: As many as 16 people tested positive for COVID-19 at the Welham Girls' School in Uttarakhand's Dehradun. As per District Magistrate R Rajesh Kumar, six of the students tested COVID-19 positive on Tuesday and the rest over the past one week. The residential school has been declared a micro-containment zone.

137.title: 26 killed, 12 injured in road accident in Ukraine: Interior Ministry
137.article_body: Ukrainian Interior Ministry said that 26 people were killed and 12 others were injured in a road accident in the country's Rivne region on Tuesday. The accident reportedly took place after a passenger bus, a minibus and a fuel truck collided, resulting in the explosion of the fuel truck. According to the ministry, the passenger bus was heading to Poland.

138.title: BJP using Raj Thackeray to divide Hindus in Maha: Raut on loudspeaker row
138.article_body: Shiv Sena's Sanjay Raut has accused BJP of orchestrating loudspeaker controversy in Maharashtra and using MNS leader Raj Thackeray to create a divide among Hindus. "Now...temples also have to bear the brunt of it. It's a black day for...Hindus [who] couldn't hear 'aartis' [through loudspeakers] because of BJP's politics," he added. There are no illegal loudspeakers in Maharashtra, Raut added.

139.title: Mumbai logs 117 COVID-19 cases in last 24 hrs, highest since Feb 25
139.article_body: Mumbai on Wednesday reported 117 new coronavirus positive cases, its highest one-day tally since February 25, which took its overall count to 10,60,187, reports said. No COVID-19 related deaths were reported, while there are 642 active cases in the city. COVID-19 infections in Mumbai ran into three figures for the second consecutive day as 100 cases were reported on Tuesday.

140.title: Clear garbage or we'll dump it at Delhi BJP chief's house: AAP
140.article_body: AAP leader Durgesh Pathak on Wednesday said that garbage will be dumped outside Delhi BJP chief Adesh Gupta's house if the party fails to clear it from the streets of Karol Bagh. He said that BJP has left no stone unturned to litter Delhi, adding that instead of paying garbage pickers, BJP is distributing the money amongst themselves.

141.title: India excludes 1,157 products from free trade pact with UAE
141.article_body: India has excluded as many as 1,157 products, including TVs, picture tubes, soaps, toys, footwear, sharbat and petroleum waxes from the ambit of India-UAE Comprehensive Economic Partnership Agreement (CEPA). As per the FAQs prepared by the Commerce Ministry, India won't provide any customs duty concessions on these products given the sensitivities of these products for the domestic industry.

142.title: Looking into other options to deal with EU's ban on oil imports: Russia
142.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin's spokesperson Dmitry Peskov has said that they are "looking into different options" after European Commission chief Ursula von der Leyen proposed a ban on all oil imports from Russia. Leyen said, "This will be...complete import ban on all Russian oil-seaborne and pipeline, crude and refined." "Putin must pay...a high price for his brutal aggression," she added.

143.title: Rahul to visit poll-bound Gujarat on May 10, will address tribals
143.article_body: Ahead of the Gujarat Assembly polls, Congress' Rahul Gandhi will visit the state on May 10 and launch 'Adivasi Adhikar Satyagrah' campaign in Dahod. "Congress will reinstate the rights of tribals...Rahul will share [party's] roadmap for...development of tribals," a party leader said. This comes days after AAP's Arvind Kejriwal announced the party's alliance with Bharatiya Tribal Party in Gujarat.

144.title: This rate hike was needed: Uday Kotak on repo rate hiked to 4.40%
144.article_body: Kotak Mahindra Bank's CEO Uday Kotak has said the Reserve Bank of India's decision to hike the repo rate by 40 bps to 4.40% is justified. "I think this rate hike was needed and I'm glad that they have acted intra-market and intra policy," Kotak stated. He added that the bank will be transmitting the rate hike to its borrowers.

145.title: CSK's Mukesh Choudhary hits Virat Kohli in direct hit attempt, apologises immediately
145.article_body: CSK pacer Mukesh Choudhary hit Virat Kohli with the ball while attempting a direct hit during RCB's first over in their IPL 2022 match on Wednesday. Kohli played the delivery straight to Mukesh, who attempted a direct hit seeing Kohli out of crease. The ball hit Kohli as he dived to get inside the crease, following which Mukesh apologised immediately.

146.title: Agnihotri says scheduled press conference for Kashmir Files was cancelled, shares chat
146.article_body: Filmmaker Vivek Agnihotri claimed that Press Club of India (PCI) cancelled a scheduled press conference on 'The Kashmir Files'. "The watchdogs of democracy...not only banned me undemocratically but are also lying through their teeth," Agnihotri tweeted, sharing messages of an agency directed to book PCI. He further said the press conference will now be held at a Delhi 5-star hotel.

147.title: Farmer finds 11.88-carat diamond worth around ₹50 lakh in MP mine
147.article_body: A small-time farmer in Madhya Pradesh's Panna district has found an 11.88-carat diamond in a mine. As per private estimates, the diamond may fetch over ₹50 lakh at an auction. The money received from the auction will be used for setting up a business and for the education of the farmer's children.

148.title: Royal Bengal Tiger attacks animal keeper at Chennai's Vandalur Zoo
148.article_body: An animal keeper at Chennai's Vandalur Zoo sustained minor injuries after he was attacked by a Royal Bengal Tiger. The animal keeper, identified as Chellaiya, has been with the wildlife sanctuary for more than three decades now, officials said. "The tiger was not keeping well...The caretaker...was present alongside the veterinary team so nothing major happened," the zoo director said.

149.title: Investors lose ₹6.27 lakh crore as Sensex crashes 1,300 points after repo rate hike
149.article_body: Investors lost ₹6.27 lakh crore on Wednesday after the Sensex ended 1,306 points lower, at 55,669, after the RBI announced a 40 bps hike in repo rate to 4.40%. The broader NSE Nifty tanked 392 points to finish at 16,678. Bajaj Finance was the biggest loser in the Sensex pack, followed by Bajaj Finserv, Titan, IndusInd Bank and HDFC Bank.

150.title: Which cricketers have played the most matches for a single franchise in IPL?
150.article_body: CSK captain MS Dhoni on Wednesday became the second player after RCB's Virat Kohli to play 200 matches for a single franchise in IPL. Kohli is playing his 218th IPL match for RCB today, the most IPL matches by a player for a single franchise. Kohli and Dhoni are followed by Kieron Pollard (187, MI) and Rohit Sharma (177, MI).

151.title: Rohit, Tiger to invest 4-5 months to prepare for 'Rambo': Report
151.article_body: Filmmaker Rohit Dhawan and actor Tiger Shroff will reportedly be investing four to five months to prepare for their upcoming film 'Rambo'. "Rohit will start working on it after he wraps up...'Shehzada' with Kartik Aaryan and Kriti Sanon," a source told Pinkvilla. "While Tiger will train for the larger-than-life action sequences, Rohit will begin the pre-production formalities," the source added.

152.title: Chennai man beaten to death by de-addiction centre workers, 7 held
152.article_body: Chennai Police said that a 48-year-old man was beaten to death by workers at a de-addiction centre and seven people were arrested in the case. The police found out that the deceased, M Raj, who was addicted to alcohol, had created a ruckus at the de-addiction centre and was beaten up by facility workers with sticks and other items.

153.title: Mother of two raped by a 20-year-old in Andhra's Vizianagaram
153.article_body: A 26-year-old woman, a mother of two children, was raped by a 20-year-old man at her residence in Andhra Pradesh's Vizianagaram. Police said that the victim had separated from her husband and was staying in a rented house in Vizianagaram with her children. Deepika Patil, Vizianagaram Superintendent of Police, said that the accused was taken into custody.

154.title: Pics show gifts PM Modi gave to leaders of 5 nations he met in Denmark
154.article_body: After meeting leaders of Nordic countries, PM Narendra Modi gifted Rogan Painting from Gujarat to Denmark Queen Margrethe II. He gifted a Pashmina stole in Papier Mache box from J&K to Sweden PM Magdalena Andersson and a Brass Tree of Life from Rajasthan to Finland PM Sanna Marin. He gifted Dokra boat from Chhattisgarh to Crown Prince Frederik of Denmark.

155.title: AAP's Raghav Chadha, Atishi booked for 'defamatory remarks' against BJP
155.article_body: The Delhi Police have named AAP MP Raghav Chadha and MLA Atishi in a non-cognizable report for their alleged defamatory remarks against BJP and its workers. "Atishi and...Raghav Chadha referred to BJP workers as criminals, hooligans, rapists during press conferences on April 15 and 16," the report, which was registered based on BJP IT cell chief Abhishek Dubey's complaint, noted.

156.title: DRG jawan martyred in encounter with Naxals in Chhattisgarh
156.article_body: Police said that a District Reserve Guard (DRG) head constable was killed in an encounter with Naxals in Chhattisgarh's Narayanpur district. The encounter took place around 8.15 am on Wednesday at a forest in Tulargufa-Mungari area, IGP Sundarraj P said. A joint team of various security forces was out on a search operation when the encounter took place, he added.

157.title: Culprits involved in riots will not be spared: Rajasthan CM
157.article_body: Rajasthan Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot said the culprits involved in riots will not be spared and added that the government was taking steps to ensure no violence takes place in Rajasthan. "No one has the right to take law and order in their hands," he added. His comment comes after communal clashes in Jodhpur on Tuesday.

158.title: NHRC issues notice to UP Chief Secy, DGP over gang-rape of 13-yr-old
158.article_body: The National Human Rights Commission on Wednesday issued notices to the Chief Secretary and Director General of UP Police and sought a report within four weeks over the alleged gang-rape of a 13-year-old. Stating that it had taken suo motu cognisance of media reports of the case, the Commission said the content amounted to human rights violation of the victim.

159.title: EU promises more military aid for Moldova amid Ukraine crisis
159.article_body: European Union (EU) pledged more military assistance for Ukraine's neighbouring country Moldova on Wednesday amid the former's invasion. European Council President Charles Michel said that EU will step up aid for Moldova in the "field of logistics [and] cyber defence". The move comes amid reports of unrest in Moldova's breakaway region of Transnistria, which is controlled by pro-Russian forces.

160.title: Filmmaker Rohit Dhawan, wife Jaanvi blessed with a baby boy
160.article_body: Rohit Dhawan and his wife Jaanvi Dhawan welcomed a baby boy. This is their second child together after the birth of their daughter Niyara in 2018. A media account shared a video of Rohit and his father David Dhawan stepping out of PD Hinduja Hospital in Mumbai. Rohit made his directorial debut with Akshay Kumar and John Abraham-starrer 'Desi Boyz'.

161.title: Pfizer opens Asia's 1st global drug development centre in Chennai
161.article_body: US pharmaceutical company Pfizer on Wednesday launched a global drug research and development centre at the IIT Madras Research Park in Chennai at an initial investment of ₹150 crore. The 61,000-square-foot facility is among 12 centres established worldwide and the first in Asia. It employs 250 scientists and technicians, and would develop and support products in global markets, Pfizer said.

162.title: India's services exports set new record of $254.4 billion in FY22
162.article_body: Commerce Ministry on Wednesday said India's services exports set a new record of $254.4 billion (over ₹19 lakh crore) in FY22. It added that services exports also hit an all-time monthly high of $26.9 billion in March 2022. The top contributors to the exports were transport, telecommunications and computer and information services, the Ministry added.

163.title: Man crashes ₹5 crore Ford GT supercar just days after buying it in US
163.article_body: A 50-year-old man crashed his Ford GT car into a tree just days after buying it for $704,000 (over ₹5 crore) at a US auction. Police report said that the crash was caused by inexperience with a manual transmission. The driver claimed that old tires, muddy pavement and fresh detailing caused the car to swing out and hit a tree.

164.title: PM Modi's pic in Germany from 1993 surfaces amid his Europe tour
164.article_body: An old picture of PM Narendra Modi in Germany has surfaced on social media amid his Europe tour. It shows a young PM Modi, when he was a BJP worker, and one of his colleagues standing before statue of Charlemagne. It was reportedly taken in 1993 in Frankfurt, where he had a brief halt while returning to India from US.

165.title: I focus on my work: Kartik Aaryan on Dharma Productions controversy
165.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan has opened up about his controversy with Karan Johar's Dharma Productions after the actor was no longer a part of 'Dostana 2'. "I just focus on my work. That's all I would like to say about this," Kartik stated. "What happens...is people make a mountain out of a molehill. There's nothing more to it," he added.

166.title: Congress cell's lawyers yell at Chidambaram, show him black robes at Calcutta HC
166.article_body: Senior Congress leader and advocate P Chidambaram faced protest by lawyers of Congress' legal cell at Calcutta High Court. The video of the incident shows the lawyers showing him black robes and shouting slogans, saying he's a TMC sympathiser and responsible for Congress' poor show in West Bengal. Chidambaram was reportedly representing a company sued by Congress' Adhir Chowdhury.

167.title: Putin miscalculated his brutal invasion of Ukraine: Chancellor Scholz
167.article_body: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz on Wednesday said that Russian President Vladimir Putin "completely miscalculated with his brutal invasion of Ukraine". Scholz said that Putin is now facing "a stronger NATO" and "a unified European Union". His remarks came after a two-day closed-door German Cabinet meeting on the ongoing Russia-Ukraine war and its impact on the German economy ended today.

168.title: Baseball signed by Ukrainian Prez Zelenskyy to be sold for war relief aid
168.article_body: A baseball signed by Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy is being auctioned in US to raise funds for Ukraine amid its ongoing invasion. The leading bid for the baseball as of Tuesday had exceeded $15,000 (over ₹11 lakh), the auctioneer confirmed. Zelenskyy had signed the ball in 2019 for an American collector, Randy Kaplan, who collects baseballs signed by world leaders.

169.title: Mumbai man's edited obscene pic leaked after he fails to repay loan
169.article_body: Mumbai police have registered an FIR against unknown persons for circulating a morphed obscene photo of a 23-year-old man after he failed to repay loans worth ₹6,000. The complainant said that he took the loans from two mobile applications. He added that six members of his family and locality had received the photo, which came from five different numbers.

170.title: CSK to bowl first against RCB, Dhoni featuring in his 200th IPL match for CSK
170.article_body: CSK captain MS Dhoni won the toss and elected to bowl first against RCB in their IPL 2022 match on Wednesday. Dhoni is playing his 200th IPL match for CSK. CSK have made one change to their playing XI, with Moeen Ali replacing Mitchell Santner. Meanwhile, RCB are fielding an unchanged side.

171.title: Ex-Pak PM Imran Khan calls for early polls under ‘neutral’ authority
171.article_body: Ex-Pakistan PM Imran Khan on Tuesday called for expedited general elections, adding that it should be held under supervision of a "neutral" chief election commissioner. Khan, who was ousted from power via a no-trust vote in parliament last month, stated that new government has been imposed on people. PML-N leader Shehbaz Sharif took oath as Pakistan PM on April 11.

172.title: Policeman who raped 13-yr-old rape survivor in UP police station arrested
172.article_body: The Station House Officer (SHO), who allegedly raped a 13-year-old rape survivor when she had gone to the police station to file a complaint in Uttar Pradesh's Lalitpur, has been arrested from Prayagraj. The police officer was absconding. Earlier, the SHO was suspended and all policemen of the police station in Lalitpur were sent to police lines.

173.title: Ukraine war set to worsen severe hunger worldwide: UN report
173.article_body: UN's Global Network Against Food Crises said that Russia's invasion of Ukraine poses serious risks to global food security. In a report, it said the number of people facing acute food insecurity and requiring urgent life-saving food assistance has nearly doubled since 2016. "If more isn't done to support rural communities...scale of...devastation in terms of hunger...will be appalling," it added.

174.title: 78% of Indian organisations hit by ransomware in 2021: Survey
174.article_body: As many as 78% of Indian organisations were hit with ransomware in 2021, up from 68% in 2020, a survey by security vendor Sophos claimed.
