It said the average ransom paid by Indian organisations that had their data encrypted in most significant ransomware attacks was $1.2 million. Some 10% of victims payed ransoms of $1 million or more, it added.

175.title: Adani's Mumbai International Airport raises $750 mn from Apollo
175.article_body: Adani Enterprises said its subsidiary Mumbai International Airport Ltd (MIAL), which runs the Mumbai airport, has raised $750 million senior secured private placement notes from Apollo-managed credit funds. The proceeds will be used to refinance existing shorter maturity loans and new capital expenditure, it added. In March, Adani Enterprises concluded financing of its Navi Mumbai airport.

176.title: Ahan Shetty reacts to Athiya Shetty & KL Rahul's wedding reports
176.article_body: Reacting to reports of his sister Athiya Shetty and cricketer KL Rahul's wedding, Ahan Shetty said, "There's no such ceremony, these are all rumours." He added, "When there's no wedding, how can we give you a date?" Ahan said that the duo have not even been engaged and stated, "There's no planning for a wedding in the next few months."

177.title: Negative comments do affect me, I'm not an android: Elon Musk
177.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk, while speaking on Met Gala's red carpet, said that he's not immune to the negative comments made about him. "Well, it does get to me sometimes, I mean...I do have feelings. I'm not an android," he stated. He, however, added that he tries to "take these things with a grain of salt".

178.title: Loudspeakers removed peacefully from mosques in UP: Dy CM Maurya
178.article_body: UP Deputy Chief Minister Keshav Prasad Maurya said on Wednesday that the peaceful manner in which loudspeakers are being removed from religious places in state "is an example for the entire country". "Opposition always makes provocative remarks but...law and order in UP is [fine]," he added. Nearly 54,000 loudspeakers were removed from religious places in UP till May 1.

179.title: 91% of 11 lakh people in Delhi believe BJP orchestrates riots: AAP
179.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party claimed that 91% of the 11.5 lakh respondents to its survey in Delhi believe that BJP orchestrates riots. Responding to the second question, which was about the party having the highest number of goons, 89% of people said it's BJP, 5% believed it's Congress and 2% said it's AAP, according to Deputy CM of Delhi Manish Sisodia.

180.title: Civic authorities asked to raze down illegal structures in Thane
180.article_body: Senior civic officials of the Kalyan Dombivli Municipal Corporation (KDMC) in Maharashtra's Thane have been asked to take action against illegal structures and encroachments, officials said. KDMC commissioner Dr Vijay Suryavanshi said land sharks encroached on civic utility lands and carried out construction work, the official added. He directed officials to identify such properties and raze them.

181.title: I like being different: World's tallest living woman who holds 4 world records
181.article_body: Turkey's Rumeysa Gelgi, the tallest living woman at 7-feet-0.7-inch height with four Guinness World Records, said, "I like being different from everyone else." She also holds records for the longest finger on a living person (female), the largest hands on a living person (female) and the longest back on a living person (female). Her height is due to Weaver syndrome.

182.title: NATO barking at Russia's door may have facilitated Ukraine's invasion: Pope Francis
182.article_body: Pope Francis said that NATO "barking" at Russia's door may have led to Russian President Vladimir Putin's invasion of Ukraine. "I wouldn't know if this provoked an ire but perhaps it facilitated it," he stated. Asked about a trip to the Ukrainian capital Kyiv, the Pope said, "First, I've to go to Moscow, first I have to meet Putin."

183.title: AAP workers protest against corruption in KPSC in B'luru, detained
183.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) workers protested against Karnataka Public Service Commission (KPSC) in Bengaluru over alleged corruption after which the workers were detained by the police. The protest was led by AAP's Bengaluru President Mohan Dasari. "People who appear for KPSC are not seeing any hopes. Every year one or the other scam emerges in KPSC," he said.

184.title: Booking MP Navneet, MLA Ravi Rana for sedition was stupidity: Fadnavis
184.article_body: Former Maharashtra CM and BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis on Wednesday said Mumbai Police's decision to book Amravati MP Navneet Rana and her MLA-husband Ravi Rana for sedition was stupidity. "There can not be anything more stupid than arresting someone for reciting the Hanuman Chalisa. This was foolishness of the government and the grant of bail establishes that," Fadnavis said.

185.title: People in Hyd take out boats as rain brings relief & waterlogging
185.article_body: People in Hyderabad used rubber boats after heavy rains lashed parts of the city on Wednesday morning causing waterlogging in many areas. A PTI report said waterlogging and inundation were seen in several localities of Hyderabad, including Amberpet, Kukatpally, Malkajgiri and Musheerabad and the old city. Thundershowers are likely to occur in parts of Telangana, IMD said.

186.title: Tamil Nadu administration bans Mutt's palanquin ritual; devotees protest
186.article_body: Tamil Nadu administration denied permission for 'Pattina Pravesam' ritual in Mayiladuthurai in which devotees carry the Dharmapuram mutt's seer on a silver palanquin. A group of devotees held a protest against the government's decision ahead of the ritual scheduled for May 22. State BJP chief K Annamalai said he would lift the palanquin himself if authorities didn't allow the ritual.

187.title: PM Modi meets leaders of 5 countries in Denmark, pic released
187.article_body: PM Narendra Modi met leaders of Denmark, Finland, Iceland, Norway and Sweden on Wednesday for the second India-Nordic Summit in Copenhagen. Releasing the picture of the leaders, External Affairs Ministry Spokesperson said, "The 2018 Summit in Stockholm was the 1st time India engaged with the Nordic countries as a group on a single platform."

188.title: PM adopted policy of 'All rank, No pension'; insult to nation: Rahul
188.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday accused PM Narendra Modi of adopting the 'All Rank, No Pension' policy after the scam of the 'One Rank, One Pension' policy. He also accused PM of insulting the nation by not giving pensions to hundreds of servicemen, including three-star officers. The government should give pensions to former servicemen at the earliest, he said.

189.title: Pune Police look for man who sought ₹7cr for ‘bomb threat’ information
189.article_body: Pune Police have launched search to track a man who made hoax call on Tuesday regarding 'bomb threat' at a railway station. The accused, who dialed emergency helpline number 112, sought ₹7 crore from authorities to reveal the location. "As we launched a probe into...call, we also mobilised...Bomb Detection and Disposal Squad and other quick response teams," an official said.

190.title: Biggest kept secret: Benedict on if Cruise appears in Doctor Strange 2
190.article_body: Actor Benedict Cumberbatch has reacted to the rumours of actor Tom Cruise being part of his film 'Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness'. "Tom? Yeah, he's in every scene you haven't seen in the trailer. It's the biggest kept secret," Benedict said. Speaking about fan theories, he said, "I try not to react or go to the internet."

191.title: Vibrant independent press a cornerstone for healthy democracy: Blinken
191.article_body: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken on Tuesday said that a vibrant independent press is a cornerstone for any healthy democracy. He further said that exercise of freedom of the press is facing profound threats in the current time. "Governments are supplementing traditional forms of repression with new tactics aimed at undermining press freedom," he added.

192.title: 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar' faces legal action over sex-determination scene
192.article_body: Ranveer Singh-starrer 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar' is facing legal action in Delhi High Court over the prenatal sex determination scene in the trailer. According to Live Law, advocate Pawan Prakash Pathak's plea stated that the practice of prenatal sex determination as shown in the trailer is prohibited. In the plea, Pawan asked for the scene to be deleted for promoting prohibited activities.

193.title: PM Modi meets Finland PM, discusses ways to deepen bilateral ties
193.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Wednesday met Finland PM Sanna Marin during his Europe tour and discussed ways to further deepen bilateral ties. "There is immense potential in expanding the India-Finland digital partnership, trade partnership and investment linkages," PM Modi said. He also held a series of bilateral meetings with his counterparts from Norway, Sweden and Iceland.

194.title: Sundar Pichai fact-checks his Wikipedia page edits, says 'I wasn't homeschooled'
194.article_body: Google and Alphabet CEO Sundar Pichai during a recent interview fact-checked edits made by people on the Wikipedia page about him. On an edit claiming he was homeschooled, Pichai clarified, "I wasn't homeschooled." On edits naming several Indian schools that Pichai studied at, he clarified, "Two schools are right...the final school is 'Vana Vani', situated in the IIT Madras campus."

195.title: LIC IPO subscribed 63% on Day 1; staff, policyholder portions fully subscribed
195.article_body: India's biggest-ever IPO of LIC was subscribed 63% till 5:06 pm on the first day of bidding on Wednesday. The LIC policyholders led the initial bout of buying in LIC's IPO as they subscribed 1.84 times the portion reserved for them. The employee reserved portion has subscribed 104% while the retail investors' portion has been subscribed 56%, Moneycontrol reported.

196.title: Pic shows strong solar flare erupting from Sun, NASA highlights its impact on Earth
196.article_body: The Sun emitted a strong solar flare on April 30, an image of which has been shared by NASA. It can be seen in the bright flash in the picture's upper right portion. Solar flares are sudden releases of magnetic energy, which if directed towards Earth, can impact radio communications, electric power grids and pose risks to spacecraft and astronauts.

197.title: Rahul never spoke for T'gana, his visit to state is political: TRS MLC
197.article_body: TRS MLC K Kavitha on Wednesday termed Congress leader Rahul Gandhi's upcoming visit to Telangana 'politically motivated', adding that he'd never spoken for the state's welfare. "During...paddy crop issue, we urged him (Rahul Gandhi) to raise the issue in Parliament..but he did not," she said. Her remarks come days after Gandhi was denied permission to visit Hyderabad's Osmania University.

198.title: EU proposes Russian oil ban to make Putin 'pay high price' for Ukraine
198.article_body: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen has proposed a ban on all oil imports from Russia by year-end to make President Vladimir Putin pay a "high price for his brutal aggression" in Ukraine. The ban would be part of EU's sixth package of sanctions against Russia. The proposal requires approval from all 27 member countries to come into effect.

199.title: RCB's NRR is so bad that only points can take them through: Shaun Pollock
199.article_body: Ex-MI all-rounder Shaun Pollock said RCB's net run-rate (NRR) in IPL 2022 so far is "so bad" that only points can take them through. "You don't see them squeaking through after being level on points. It is all about winning," added Pollock. Talking about CSK who will face RCB today, Pollock stated that CSK cannot afford to make a mistake.

200.title: B'luru Traffic Police creates green corridor for live heart transportation
200.article_body: Bengaluru Traffic Police on Wednesday created a green corridor for transporting a live heart to a hospital in the city and also shared a video of the same on Twitter. The corridor to carry the live heart was created between Manipal Hospital in Hebbal to MS Ramaiah Memorial Hospital. Police also provided a green corridor for transportation of liver today.

201.title: Extreme Muslim appeasement: BJP to KCR on allowing to write Group I exams in Urdu
201.article_body: The BJP criticised the Telangana government over its decision of giving option to write exams for Group I posts in Urdu language and said that CM K Chandrashekar Rao was indulging in politics of appeasement for his vote bank. "This is extreme Muslim appeasement...The exam written in Urdu can only be corrected by a Muslim," BJP MP Arvind Dharmapuri said.

202.title: Man takes off 2 girls' clothes, urinates in Delhi school; principal tells girls 'forget it'
202.article_body: Delhi Commission for Women chief Swati Maliwal has issued a notice to police after a man allegedly entered a municipal school in Delhi and sexually assaulted two girls. She said the man took off the girls' clothes and urinated in front of an entire class. "When the girls told the principal & teacher, they said 'forget about it'," Maliwal added.

203.title: My 1st shot ever was an action sequence: Akshay on 30 yrs in B'wood
203.article_body: After completing 30 years in Indian cinema, actor Akshay Kumar recalled the first-ever shot of his filming career. In a video clip released by YRF's Twitter handle, Akshay can be heard saying, "Pehla shot action ka diya tha Ooty mein (My first shot ever was an action sequence in Ooty)." The actor made his Bollywood debut with 'Saugandh' in 1991.

204.title: Announce dates of BMC elections within 2 weeks: SC tells Maha govt
204.article_body: The Supreme Court has ordered the Uddhav Thackeray-led Maharashtra government to declare schedule for the pending BMC elections within two weeks. The apex court also said that the matter of OBC reservation in the election will be heard later. Earlier, the state government had said that BMC elections will be held only after OBC reservation in the elections was approved.

205.title: Hyd police advises people to drive safe amid rainfall, waterlogging
205.article_body: The Hyderabad Traffic Police alerted people to drive safe amid rainfall in the city on Wednesday. The traffic police also shared a video of a waterlogged road in the city and wrote, "It's raining. Please drive carefully." Waterlogging was seen in several localities, including Amberpet, Kukatpally, Malkajgiri, Musheerabad and the old city.

206.title: No masks or COVID-19 tests needed to attend Cannes: General secretary
206.article_body: Cannes general secretary Francois Desrousseaux has said that guests attending the 2022 event will not have to show proof of testing or vaccination. "Most participants will likely be vaccinated anyway because France has made it very complicated for non-vaccinated travellers to enter the country," Francois added. He said masks will no longer be mandatory indoors, however, are strongly recommended.

207.title: Russia warns it'll target transport carrying NATO weapons in Ukraine
207.article_body: Russian Defence Minister Sergei Shoigu on Wednesday accused the US and its NATO allies of "continuing to pump weapons into Ukraine".  "We view any transport of...NATO arriving on the territory of the country with weapons or materials destined to the Ukrainian army as a target to be destroyed," Shoigu warned on day 70 of Russia's 'special military operation' in Ukraine.

208.title: EU chief proposes phased ban on all Russian oil imports
208.article_body: European Commission chief Ursula von der Leyen on Wednesday proposed a phased oil embargo on Russia, sanctions on its top bank and a ban on Russian broadcasters from European airwaves. "Today, we will propose to ban all Russian oil from Europe. This will be a complete import ban on all Russian oil-seaborne and pipeline, crude and refined," Leyen said.

209.title: Time will reply: Sidhu after disciplinary action sought against him
209.article_body: Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu on Wednesday shared a tweet, days after Punjab Congress in-charge Harish Chaudhary sought disciplinary action against him. "I often listen in silence to conversations against me...I have given...right to reply to time," Sidhu tweeted in Hindi. Chaudhary wrote a letter to Sonia Gandhi seeking action against Sidhu for trying to "portray himself above the party".

210.title: Vendor refuses to give free bhelpuri to drunk man in Gurugram, killed
210.article_body: A drunk man allegedly killed a 40-year-old street vendor in Gurugram after he refused to serve him bhelpuri for free, police said on Tuesday. The incident took place on Monday when Ram was on his way home with his wife, who alleged that a half-naked man hurled a stone at her husband, which hit the back of his head.

211.title: 3 Char Dham pilgrims die of heart attacks on way to Yamunotri
211.article_body: Three elderly pilgrims, including a woman, died of heart attacks on way to Yamunotri on Tuesday, the opening day of the Char Dham Yatra. The district's Disaster Management Officer, Devendra Patwal, said that all the deaths occurred at different spots along the trek route from Jankichatti to the Himalayan temple. All the three deceased persons were aged above 60 years.

212.title: RBI Governor warns of inflation, higher edible oil prices
212.article_body: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das has warned that edible oil prices may go further up despite the central bank hiking the repo rate by 40 bps to 4.40%. He said it was due to export restrictions by key producing countries and the loss of sunflower oil output amid Russia-Ukraine war. "Looking ahead, food inflation pressures are likely to continue," he stated.

213.title: Mumbai Police shares Blake Lively's Met Gala pics in password awareness post
213.article_body: Mumbai Police took to Instagram to share pictures of actress Blake Lively to make a reference about her dress transformation at Met Gala 2022. "Keep your passwords 'Lively'. Change them frequently," Mumbai Police wrote. Lively had worn a red-toned gown with a large bow. The actress' bow was later untied and unveiled the blue part of the gown.

214.title: I try to find out where they've come from: MI's Zaheer on working with youngsters
214.article_body: Opening up on his role as MI's Director of Cricket Operations, ex-India pacer Zaheer Khan said he helps players with the technical and mental aspects of the game. "It's important to get to know each other. So, I always try and find out where they have come from...anyone should be comfortable coming up and having conversations," he stated.

215.title: Rahul seen with those who challenge India's territorial integrity: BJP
215.article_body: A day after a video of Rahul Gandhi partying at a nightclub in Nepal surfaced online, BJP leader Amit Malviya asked why he's only seen with those who challenge India's territorial integrity. "Rahul Gandhi was supposedly at the wedding of Sumnima Udas, a Nepali diplomat's daughter, who actively supports Nepal's claims over regions of India's Uttarakhand," Malviya tweeted.

216.title: Zomato shares hit record low of ₹64, fall over 7% on Wednesday
216.article_body: Shares of food delivery giant Zomato hit a new record low of ₹64 as they fell 7.13% to close at ₹64.5 on Wednesday. Zomato has wiped out over half of its investors' wealth since January 3, when its stock price hit a high of ₹142.45. Zomato had launched its IPO in July 2021 with a price band of ₹72-76.

217.title: Need your wishes: Bhuvan Bam on making OTT debut with Taaza Khabar
217.article_body: YouTuber Bhuvan Bam announced his OTT debut on Wednesday. Sharing two pictures on Instagram, Bhuvan revealed the title of the project, 'Taaza Khabar'. Alongside the post, he wrote, "Need your wishes for my OTT debut. Your constant support has been a boon for me. New stuff this year." In the first picture, Bhuvan is seen holding Taaza Khabar's script.

218.title: He would've got 80-90 in 50 balls at his peak: Ojha on Kohli's 58 (53) vs GT
218.article_body: Reacting to Virat Kohli's 53-ball 58 in RCB's defeat against GT by six wickets, ex-India spinner Pragyan Ojha said, "Had he played 50 balls at his peak, he would have been on 80-90." "[I] want Kohli to play a bit more aggressively," added Ojha. Kohli has scored 186 runs in IPL 2022 so far at a strike rate of 116.25.

219.title: Britons buying less meat and fish, struggling to pay bills: Report
219.article_body: The Britons are buying less meat, fish and poultry owing to the rise in cost of living, market research firm NielsenIQ has said. The volume sales of those items decreased by 13% year-on-year in the four weeks leading to April 23. According to official data revealed last week, nearly one-fourth of the citizens were struggling to pay their household bills.

220.title: Beijing partly shuts down public transport to control COVID-19 spread
220.article_body: Beijing on Wednesday closed 40 subway stations and around 150 bus routes to restrict movement in a bid to curb the spread of COVID-19. The move comes days after the city barred dine-in services at restaurants and suspended in-person classes in schools till May 11. Additionally, city residents are required to undergo three COVID-19 tests throughout the week.

221.title: Couple killed, several injured as truck hits bus carrying pilgrims in UP
221.article_body: An elderly couple died while several others were injured after a bus carrying pilgrims was hit by a container truck in UP's Etawah on Wednesday. According to the Assistant Superintendent of Police (ASP), 50 passengers were on the bus when it met with an accident on the Agra-Lucknow Expressway. Ten injured people were admitted to hospital, the officer added.

222.title: Delhi govt announces free bus travel for construction workers
222.article_body: The Aam Aadmi Party-led Delhi government announced that they will make travel free for construction labourers working in the national capital. "All construction labourers earlier had to spend somewhere between ₹1000 to ₹3000 per month for travelling," Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia said. "This (step) will benefit about 10 lakh labourers in the state," he added.

223.title: Comedian Dave Chappelle attacked on stage, Chris Rock jokes 'Was that Will Smith?'
223.article_body: Comedian Dave Chappelle was attacked on stage while performing at an event in Los Angeles, according to reports at the scene. As per ABC journalist Stephanie Wash's tweet, Chris Rock, who performed earlier, came on stage and joked, "Was that Will Smith?" Chris was slapped by Smith on stage at Oscars this year.

224.title: How will the RBI's repo rate hike affect loan EMIs and FD rates?
224.article_body: The Reserve Bank of India's (RBI) Governor Shaktikanta Das on Wednesday announced that the repo rate has been increased by 40 bps to 4.40% with immediate effect. This can lead to banks hiking EMI rates of home, auto or personal loans. The repo rate hike can however mean better returns for FD (Fixed Deposit) investors on new FDs.

225.title: Have emergency backup plan in case of power outage: Delhi Metro
225.article_body: Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) Managing Director Vikas Kumar on Tuesday said that DMRC is not facing any power crisis currently and has backup plans for any emergency. "DMRC receives 99 MW of electricity...through its off-site solar plant and generates 50 MW from the rooftop solar plants," Kumar said. "We are only 50% dependent on discoms," he added.

226.title: BMRCL spares over 100 trees and 152-yr-old church with revised station plan
226.article_body: The Bengaluru Metro Rail Corporation Limited (BMRCL) has decided to spare over 100 trees and the 152-year-old All Saints' Church on Hosur Road as it revised the underground metro station plan. The decision to revise the plan comes after the church group, along with some NGOs and groups, complained to European Investment Bank (EIB), which was funding the metro construction.

227.title: 2 surprises cancelling each other out: Du Plessis on CSK captaincy change
227.article_body: Talking about Ravindra Jadeja handing back CSK captaincy to MS Dhoni, RCB captain Faf du Plessis said, "I'm surprised [it] happened mid-IPL 2022." He added, "But I was also surprised at the way it happened...before the season. So, it's like two surprises cancelling each other out." Du Plessis further said, "Obviously...there's no secret...when MS is there, he is the captain."

228.title: 'I have had my share of disappointments': RBI Governor quotes Mahatma Gandhi
228.article_body: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das, who on Wednesday announced the repo rate is being hiked by 40 bps to 4.40%, quoted Mahatma Gandhi during his address. "As Mahatma Gandhi said: "I have had my share of disappointments, uttermost darkness, but I am able to say that my faith has ultimately conquered every one of these difficulties"," Das said during his address.

229.title: B'wood can be unforgiving if you aren't from film background: Pooja
229.article_body: Speaking about her sporadic Hindi film career, actress Pooja Hegde said that it was a conscious decision to not do many Hindi films. "I've been offered films opposite big stars but those characters didn't add any value to the script," she added. "[Bollywood] can be...unforgiving if you aren't from...film background...it takes...time to get the...roles...you want to do," she said.

230.title: Tanzanian national held in Hyderabad with heroin worth ₹11.53 crore
230.article_body: The Air Intelligence Unit (AIU) on Tuesday arrested a Tanzanian national from Hyderabad's Rajiv Gandhi International Airport and seized 1389.1 gram of heroin worth ₹11.53 crore. According to officials, 108 capsules containing heroin, wrapped in an adhesive transparent tape were recovered from him. "During...investigation, it was revealed that he swallowed the capsules in Tanzania," officials said.

231.title: Need to protect women's right to choose: Biden on abortion draft
231.article_body: Amid reports of a leaked Supreme Court draft that would challenge a landmark abortion rights ruling, US President Joe Biden said it would threaten basic rights like access to birth control and marriage. He said if the ruling is overturned, elected officials will have to "protect a woman's right to choose". Voters will have to elect pro-choice officials, he added.

232.title: Russia bans Japanese PM, other top officials from entering the country
232.article_body: Russia on Wednesday banned 63 Japanese citizens from entering the country "indefinitely" for engaging in "unacceptable rhetoric" against Moscow. Those barred from entering Russia include Japanese PM Fumio Kishida, Foreign Minister Yoshimasa Hayashi, Defence Minister Nobuo Kishi and other officials, professors, and journalists. Japan has imposed sanctions on Russia over its invasion of Ukraine.

233.title: Which are the five biggest sixes of IPL 2022 so far?
233.article_body: PBKS' Liam Livingstone smashed the biggest six of IPL 2022, covering a distance of 117 metres against GT's Mohammad Shami. The second-biggest six was hit by MI's Dewald Brevis (112 metres) against PBKS' Rahul Chahar. Livingstone has also hit the third-biggest (108 metres) and the fifth-biggest six (106 metres). The fourth-biggest six (107 metres) was hit by RR's Jos Buttler.

234.title: Mandira turns off comments post getting trolled for sharing pool pics with friend
234.article_body: Actress Mandira Bedi recently took to Instagram to share a few pool pictures with her friend on his birthday. Sharing the photos, she wrote "Happy Birthday...This photograph says it all. What you mean to me...and how much I trust you." As soon as she shared the pictures, several users trolled her. Later, Mandira turned off the comments on her post.

235.title: CSK know how to make a comeback: Sunil Gavaskar
235.article_body: Ahead of CSK's game against RCB on Wednesday, former India captain Sunil Gavaskar said CSK know how to make a comeback. Gavaskar added that things turn around in a jiffy in IPL and no team can afford to take the others lightly. Currently, CSK are ninth on the IPL points table with only three wins from nine games so far.

236.title: Playing Hanuman Chalisa not a one-day affair, it will continue: Raj Thackeray
236.article_body: MNS chief Raj Thackeray said that playing Hanuman Chalisa outside mosques is not a one-day affair, it will go on until the government addresses the situation according to what the Supreme Court has said about loudspeakers. Out of 1,140 mosques in Mumbai, 135 mosques violated the guidelines, Thackeray said. What action will be taken against these mosques, he asked police.

237.title: Hit emotional breakdown; thought marriage will fix problems : Justin Bieber
237.article_body: Singer Justin Bieber said that when he first got married, he got a bit of an emotional breakdown. "I thought marriage was going to fix all my problems and it didn't. It just kind of was a reflection of like, man, you're a bit of a hypocrite man," he said, adding that religion has played important part in his life.

238.title: Hyderabad Police chief celebrates Eid with children, pics surface
238.article_body: Hyderabad Police Commissioner CV Anand celebrated Eid with children at Eidgah near Miralam while reviewing security arrangements on Tuesday. Pictures shared by the city police show the officer interacting with people on the occasion. The city Police Commissioner also distributed sweets among those present there.

239.title: Murray defeats Shapovalov to set clash against Djokovic in Madrid Open
239.article_body: Ex-world number one Andy Murray defeated Denis Shapovalov 6-1, 3-6, 6-2 to reach the third round at the Madrid Open 2022. Murray will now face Novak Djokovic in their first match since the Qatar Open final in 2017. "I haven't had that opportunity to play against Djokovic for a long time...so I'll enjoy it...give it my best," said Murray.

240.title: 54-yr-old man, his 2 grandchildren die as jeep overturns in Rajasthan
240.article_body: A 54-year-old man and his 2 grandchildren were killed as the jeep they were travelling in overturned in Rajasthan's Bikaner on Wednesday, police said. "Members of a family, including several children...were going to Bikaner city to purchase clothes for two weddings scheduled in the family on Thursday and Friday," police added. Around 13 more people were injured, police further said.

241.title: Punjab government transfers 43 IAS, 38 PCS officers
241.article_body: CM Bhagwant Mann-led Punjab government on Wednesday transferred 43 IAS and 38 PCS officers and also gave additional charges to some officers. Senior IAS officer Sarvjit Singh, who is the Additional Chief Secretary (Agriculture), has been given additional charge of soil and water conservation. Meanwhile, IAS officer Bhupinder Singh has been appointed as Special Secretary, Health and Family Welfare.

242.title: 2 Hindu sisters donate 20,400 sq ft land for Eidgah in Uttarakhand
242.article_body: Two elderly sisters named Saroj Rastogi and Anita Rastogi have donated around 20,400 sq ft of land for an Eidgah in Uttarakhand. The land has been donated to fulfil the wish of their late father. "It's a great act in such an atmosphere when our country is reeling under communal frenzy," the head of the Kashipur area's Eidgah committee said.

243.title: First time a song had such a big launch: Kartik on 'Bhool...2' title track
243.article_body: Discussing the title track of his upcoming film 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2', actor Kartik Aaryan said, "It is for the first time that a song had such a massive launch where we covered four cities in a day." "The kind of response we...got, it has truly surpassed all our expectations," added Kartik. "I am elated seeing the reaction," stated Kartik.

244.title: Religious festivals have become weapon for communal politics: Brinda Karat
244.article_body: Communist Party of India (Marxist) leader Brinda Karat said it is a matter of concern that religious festivals have become a weapon for communal politics in the country. Her remarks came following the communal clashes that took in place Rajasthan's Jodhpur. "The forces which are trying to spread unrest are succeeding in their agenda," she added.

245.title: Rain & hailstorm lash parts of Delhi amid heatwave; video surfaces
245.article_body: A hailstorm accompanied by rainfall was witnessed in parts of Delhi on Wednesday amid heatwave in parts of the country. A video has surfaced on social media showing hailstorm in the city. The IMD had issued a yellow alert and warned of a dust storm, thunderstorm or hailstorm with winds gusting up to 50 kilometres per hour in the city.

246.title: IIT Madras makes computer science courses available to the public
246.article_body: IIT Madras has made its Computer Science courses like Programming and Data Structures, Advanced Data Structures and Algorithms and Foundations of Computer System Design among others available to the general public. These courses have YouTube recordings of live lectures from the university and can be accessed by educational institutions, students or anybody else on their official website.

247.title: Journalist Boria Majumdar banned by BCCI for 2 years for bullying, threatening Saha
247.article_body: Journalist Boria Majumdar has been banned by the BCCI for two years after being found guilty of bullying, threatening and intimidating wicketkeeper-batsman Wriddhiman Saha over an interview request. Boria won't get accreditation as a member of press for any cricket matches in India for two years and he won't be allowed to interview any registered cricketer during the time period.

248.title: H'yana BJP plans outreach programme to celebrate 8 yrs of Modi govt
248.article_body: BJP's Haryana unit will launch an outreach programme on Thursday to mark the completion of eight years of PM Narendra Modi's government. BJP spokesperson Sudesh Kataria said that party leaders will take the welfare policies of the Modi government and the state government to the public during the programme. The programme intends to cover 21 lakh families in 21 days.

249.title: OnePlus 10R 5G with HyperBoost Gaming Engine available on open sale now
249.article_body: OnePlus announced that the open sale for its flagship OnePlus 10R 5G smartphone has begun today. The smartphone aims to deliver an improved gaming experience and features like 6.7" 120Hz FHD+ Fluid AMOLED display, MediaTek Dimensity 8100-MAX chipset & HyperBoost Gaming Engine. It offers two SUPERVOOC charging options, 150W and 80W, in Sierra Black & Forest Green editions.

250.title: Disgusting: Lili calls out Kim over losing weight to fit into her Met Gala dress
250.article_body: Actress Lili Reinhart seemingly called out Kim Kardashian after she admitted she went on an extreme diet in order to fit into Marilyn Monroe's dress for her Met Gala 2022 look. Taking to social media, Lili wrote, "To walk on...red carpet...where you say how starving you are...because you haven't eaten carbs...to fit in a f***ing dress...The ignorance is other-worldly disgusting."

251.title: Underground Chhatarpur metro station to link Yellow, Silver lines: Official
251.article_body: Chhatarpur station on Delhi Metro's Yellow Line will soon get an underground interchange station to connect it with the upcoming Silver Line (Tughlakabad to Aerocity), said DMRC Principal Executive Director (Corporate Communications) Anuj Dayal. The interchange facility will be provided via the existing station's gate number two. Construction of the Silver Line corridor has commenced, DMRC said.

252.title: Clashes in Rajasthan result of appeased culture of Cong govt: Vasundhara Raje
252.article_body: Former Rajasthan Chief Minister and Bharatiya Janata Party leader Vasundhara Raje on Tuesday slammed the Congress-led state government for the communal unrest in the state. "After Karauli and Alwar, the incident of communal tension has now come to the fore in Chief Minister's home town, Jodhpur. Such incidents are result of the appeased culture of Congress-led Rajasthan government," she said.

253.title: Bombay HC grants anticipatory bail to BJP MLA Ganesh Naik in rape case
253.article_body: Bombay High Court on Wednesday granted anticipatory bail to BJP Airoli MLA Ganesh Naik in a rape case. Naik was booked by the Navi Mumbai Police for allegedly threatening and raping a female friend. The woman had claimed that she had been in a live-in relationship with Naik for over 27 years and he is her son's biological father.

254.title: Sensex crashes over 1,300 points to end at 55,669 after repo rate hiked to 4.40%
254.article_body: The stock benchmarks fell the most in over eight weeks on Wednesday after the RBI announced a 40 bps hike in repo rate to 4.40%. While the Sensex tanked 1,306 points to close at 55,669, the Nifty 50 tanked 392 points to close at 16,678. Reliance Industries, HDFC Bank, HDFC and Bajaj Finance were among the top index losers.

255.title: Judge denies Heard's request to dismiss Depp's defamation lawsuit
255.article_body: Amber Heard's request to dismiss actor Johnny Depp's defamation lawsuit mid-trial has been denied by Judge Penney Azcarate.  "The court should grant the motion to strike because the undisputed evidence is...Depp did...abuse Amber," said Heard's attorney. However, the judge denied the request and said enough evidence had been presented in the ongoing trial, adding the jury will give the verdict.

256.title: I've to keep forgetting he's my brother: Selvaraghavan on working with Dhanush
256.article_body: Speaking about actor Dhanush, the actor's brother and director Selvaraghavan said, "To handle such an actor, I have to keep forgetting he is my brother. I have to keep [reminding] myself...that he has achieved a lot." "During one or two films...I had a lot of things to tell him, then he was all on his own," added Selvaraghavan.

257.title: TMC appoints ex-Lok Sabha MP Kirti Azad as its new Goa unit chief
257.article_body: Trinamool Congress (TMC) on Wednesday appointed cricketer-turned-politician Kirti Azad as its new party incharge in Goa. Azad, who previously served as a Lok Sabha MP from Bihar, had switched over to TMC from Congress in 2021. Notably, his appointment comes days after Kiran Kandolkar tendered his resignation as TMC's Goa unit chief, stating that party has 'no future in state'.

258.title: Suffered loss of ₹90,000: Delhi juice shop owner as his shop demolished
258.article_body: A juice shop owner in Delhi's Tughlaqabad, where the civic body demolished illegal construction, said his family has suffered a loss of ₹90,000. "My father and I have been running the shop for more than 23 years. I was crying and showed them the registration papers. They didn't stop," Mohammed Ashraf said. He further said, "Everything is gone now."

259.title: To see Gangubai Kathiawadi trend globally is overwhelming: Alia Bhatt
259.article_body: Speaking about the success of her film 'Gangubai Kathiawadi', actress Alia Bhatt said, "With all the love that 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' has been receiving from its viewers all over the world, I'm rendered speechless." Alia added that she's overwhelmed to see 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' trend globally. "Our rich variety of Indian films continues to captivate people around the world," she said.

260.title: I've had worst experience with Swiggy, RIP customer care: Cricketer Gowtham
260.article_body: Cricketer Krishnappa Gowtham, who made his ODI debut in 2021 against Sri Lanka, took to Twitter on Tuesday night to complain about Swiggy. "I've had the absolute worst experience with Swiggy", Gowtham tweeted, adding that he didn't receive order placed at 9:45 pm. "At 11:35 pm...I got a response from customer support saying...there's nothing they can do #RIPCUSTOMERCARE," Gowtham said.

261.title: Akhil Gogoi demands govt to implement Article 370-like provision in Assam
261.article_body: Activist and Sivasagar MLA Akhil Gogoi on Wednesday demanded that the Centre should implement Article 370-like provision in Assam for the "Constitutional safeguard" of the indigenous people of the state. "The indigenous people of the state will not be safe until Article 370 or 371 (A) like safeguards are implemented," Gogoi said.

262.title: 76% prisoners are undertrials; ratio highest in Delhi, J&K: NCRB data
262.article_body: About 76% of all prison inmates in India were undertrials, of which about 68% were either illiterate or school dropouts, as per  National Crime Records Bureau (NCRB) data for 2020. Among the undertrials, about 20% were Muslims, while about 73% were Dalits, tribals or OBCs. Delhi and J&K have highest ratio of undertrials in jails at 91%, the data showed.

263.title: Can't believe I'm such a lucky girl: Esha on completing 10 yrs in B'wood
263.article_body: Actress Esha Gupta completed ten years in Bollywood. Speaking about it, she said, "It's surreal and still feels unreal. Sometimes, I still cannot believe...I'm such a lucky girl to be an actor in the Indian film industry." "A girl from nowhere, making it to the big screen and people knowing my name! I cannot be more grateful," she added.

264.title: BJP high command instructed party to defame our govt: Rajasthan CM
264.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Wednesday said that BJP high command instructed the party to "defame" the state government and create instability. "They (BJP) bulldoze the poor people's houses," Gehlot added. "Those who've become CM candidate...There is a competition (among them) and they have been given homework, which is why they are stretching everything," Gehlot stated.

265.title: India asking Russia to discount its oil to less than $70 per barrel: Report
265.article_body: India is trying to convince Russia for deeper discounts on its oil to less than $70/barrel in order to compensate for the risk of dealing with the OPEC producer, Bloomberg reported. Global benchmark Brent is currently trading near $105/barrel. India's private and state refiners have reportedly bought over 40 million barrels of Russian crude since its invasion of Ukraine.

266.title: We've just missed out when we are chasing big totals: David Warner
266.article_body: Talking about their performance in the ongoing IPL season, DC opener David Warner said they have managed to get "close" to winning most of their games but have missed out while "chasing big totals". He added, "There's strong competition...We could get that upper hand if we beat SRH." DC, who are seventh on IPL standings, will face SRH on Thursday.

267.title: Twitter tests 'Circle' feature to share tweets with up to 150 people
267.article_body: Twitter has started testing a new feature called 'Twitter Circle' that will let users send Tweets to select people, the company announced on Tuesday.  A user can include up to 150 people in their Twitter Circle and only those individuals can interact with the Tweets shared in that Circle. Currently, the feature's available to a limited number of people globally.

268.title: Pune civic body to clean manholes with robotic machines to avoid deaths
268.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) is planning to start cleaning manholes with the help of robotic machines to avoid deaths during the cleaning. Pune Smart City Development Corporation Limited bought three robotic manhole cleaning machines and handed them over to Pune civic body. The PMC already has jetting and other machines to clean manholes but these machines require more space.

269.title: India committed to meeting needs of poor, vulnerable through infra: PM
269.article_body: India remains committed to meeting the needs of the poorest and the most vulnerable by building the next generation infrastructure to realise their aspirations, PM Narendra Modi said on Wednesday. He was addressing the inaugural session of the International Conference on Disaster Resilient Infrastructure (ICDRI). "People must be at the heart of any infrastructure growth story," PM added.

270.title: Situation under control in Jodhpur: Police Commissioner Navajyoti Gogoi
270.article_body: Jodhpur Police Commissioner Navajyoti Gogoi, on Wednesday, said the situation in the city, where communal clashes broke out recently, is under control. "Right now, the situation is under control as no such incident (violence) has erupted in the city since yesterday noon," he said. Adequate police forces have been deployed and senior officials are monitoring the situation firsthand, he added.

271.title: Pune's SPPU rejuvenates British-era pond for rainwater accumulation
271.article_body: The Savitribai Phule Pune University (SPPU) has rejuvenated a British-era pond on its premises in a joint effort with Karve Institute of Social Service for rainwater accumulation purposes. The previously defunct pond, named 'Hatti Haud', has been rebuilt and will be operational from June onwards. "The rainwater [stored]...will reduce SPPU’s dependency on municipal water supply," an official said.

272.title: RBI hikes cash reserve ratio by 50 bps to 4.5% from May 21 onwards
272.article_body: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das on Wednesday said the monetary policy committee has decided to hike the cash reserve ratio (CRR) by 50 bps to 4.5% from May 21. Withdrawal of liquidity due to the hike could be to the order of ₹87,000 crore. Average surplus liquidity in the banking system was at over ₹7 lakh crore in April, Das said.

273.title: SC denies bail to Dawood Ibrahim's nephew in 2019 extortion case
273.article_body: Supreme Court on Wednesday denied bail to fugitive gangster Dawood Ibrahim's nephew in a 2019 extortion case for alleged threats issued to a builder. "We see no reason to allow the applicant on bail at this stage...investigation is complete and the charge-sheet is filed. We direct the court to frame the charges against the accused within six months," SC said.

274.title: Nepal airport terminal evacuated over 'suspicious object' phone call
274.article_body: Passengers and staff members were on Wednesday evacuated from the domestic terminal of  Tribhuvan International Airport in Nepal after authorities received a phone call claiming that a suspicious object had been planted inside the terminal. A search is underway for the suspicious object. Authorities are also working to determine the source of the phone call.

275.title: MNS General Secy performs 'Maha Aarti' in Pune's Hanuman temple, detained
275.article_body: The Pune Police on Wednesday detained MNS General Secretary Ajay Shinde and six others after they performed 'Maha Aarti' in Khalkar Hanuman Temple. "They were detained as per preventive action," Pune Police officials said. Over 250 Maharashtra Navnirman Sena workers have been detained for playing Hanuman Chalisa on loudspeakers, Maharashtra Police said.

276.title: Naxalite, wanted in over 40 cases, killed during gunfight in Jharkhand
276.article_body: A Naxalite, wanted in over 40 cases, was killed during a gunfight with security forces in Jharkhand's Khunti district. The deceased, Laka Pahan, was the sub-zonal commander of People's Liberation Front of India (PLFI). On Wednesday morning, a group of Naxals led by Pahan opened fire on security personnel, who retaliated in self-defence, thus killing Pahan, an official said.

277.title: Destroyed phone, tore my clothes: Kerala man who renounced Islam
277.article_body: A 24-year-old Kerala man, who had renounced Islam, was allegedly attacked by a group of people before addressing an event in Kollam. He was set to speak about his experience as a student of Islamic studies. "I was manhandled. They destroyed my mobile phone and tore my clothes…When locals raised an alarm, the police saved me," he said.

278.title: Amazon doubles export target from India to $20 billion by 2025
278.article_body: Amazon on Wednesday promised to export locally produced Indian goods worth $20 billion by 2025, doubling its $10 billion-goal set in 2020 for the same time frame. The company's 'Global Selling' programme has attracted over 1,00,000 exporters since its launch in 2015 in India, it added. In 2021, over 1,000 Indian exporters on the programme crossed ₹1 crore in sales.

279.title: Metro work on B'luru's Silk Board-KR Puram line likely to be delayed
279.article_body: Metro work on Bengaluru's Silk Board-KR Puram metro line is likely to be delayed, according to a report. Bengaluru Metro Rail Corporation officials have said the delay is caused due to the shifting of gas pipelines at Kadubeesanahalli and KR Puram. "GAIL has assured us of completing the work at the earliest," BMRCL MD Anjum Parwez was quoted as saying.

280.title: Protesters block roads in Armenian capital to call for PM's resignation
280.article_body: Protesters on Wednesday blocked major roads in the Armenian capital Yerevan demanding the resignation of Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan. Protesters also called for citizens to commit acts of civil disobedience. Pashinyan has faced criticism since he agreed to a Russian-brokered ceasefire to end six weeks of war with Azerbaijan over the disputed region of Nagorno-Karabakh in November 2020.

281.title: 16-year-old Kailia Posey, grinning girl in popular GIF, dies by suicide
281.article_body: Kailia Posey, who became famous after appearing in TLC's 'Toddlers & Tiaras', has died aged 16. "Unfortunately in one impetuous moment, she made the rash decision to end her earthly life," her family told TMZ. A scene from one of the episodes, in which she grins, became one of the most popular GIFs on the internet.

282.title: Gavaskar returns 20,000 sq ft unused plot given to him 33 years ago by Maha govt
282.article_body: Ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar has returned a government plot allotted to him in Mumbai 33 years ago, an official from the Maharashtra housing agency MHADA said. Gavaskar informed the state government he couldn't set up a cricket academy at the 20,000 sq ft plot in Bandra as proposed. The MHADA had requested Gavaskar to return the unused plot last year.

283.title: Mukhtar Ansari's lawyer, son booked for misbehaving with official
283.article_body: Jailed mafia-turned-politician Mukhtar Ansari's lawyer Daroga Singh and his son Abbas Ansari have been booked by UP Police for allegedly misbehaving with a revenue worker. The incident occurred during the metering and demarcation of land owned by Singh. The Mau administration said that the land illegally acquired by Singh will be demarcated amid heavy security arrangements.

284.title: Sensex falls over 1,000 points to 55,846 after RBI hikes repo rate to 4.40%
284.article_body: Sensex tanked over 1,000 points and was trading at 55,846 on Wednesday after the RBI announced a hike in the repo rate by 40 bps to 4.40%. The Nifty 50 was also down over 330 points and was trading at around 16,736. "We must remain in readiness to use policy tools to preserve macro stability," RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das said.

285.title: Man creates ruckus at Chennai de-addiction centre, beaten to death; 7 held
285.article_body: Police have arrested seven people in connection with the death of a 48-year-old man, M Raj, who was admitted to a de-addiction centre in Chennai. Police found out that the man had created a ruckus at the centre, following which, the workers beat him with sticks and other things. Reports said that Raj's family found bruise marks on his body.

286.title: He is IPL legend: Irfan Pathan on Dhawan's 62*(53) vs GT
286.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Irfan Pathan called PBKS opener Shikhar Dhawan "an IPL legend" after he remained unbeaten at 62 to help them win against GT. "The 15th season is going on and there have only been two seasons where he hasn't scored 300 runs," added Pathan. So far, Dhawan has scored 369 runs in 10 games in IPL 2022.

287.title: MBBS students in Maha told to finish internships in hospitals of own colleges
287.article_body: The Maharashtra University of Health Sciences (MUHS) has asked medical students in the state to compulsorily complete their internships at the hospitals attached to their own institutes. A circular regarding the same was issued on Monday. Earlier, students were allowed to finish internships at hospitals attached to medical colleges other than the ones they had enrolled in for MBBS.

288.title: Film's politics is important, it zeroes down to what's your intention: Kabir
288.article_body: Filmmaker Kabir Khan said he is worried when people in industry say they are apolitical. "The way we frame a character is telling our politics...The politics of a film is very important, as it zeroes down to what is your intention and what do you want to show ultimately," he said, adding one cannot be apolitical as a human being.

289.title: J&K LG lays foundation stone for Amarnath Shrine Board Office in Srinagar
289.article_body: Manoj Sinha, the Lieutenant Governor of Jammu and Kashmir, laid the foundation stone of the Amarnath Shrine Board Office in Srinagar on Tuesday. Earlier on Monday, Nitishwar Kumar, Principal Secretary to the LG had also taken tour of the proposed sites for halt stations like Baltal Base Camp, Domail access point, etc. to ensure smooth conduct of the Amarnath Yatra.

290.title: RBI increases repo rate by 40 bps to 4.40% with immediate effect
290.article_body: The Reserve Bank of India's (RBI) Governor Shaktikanta Das on Wednesday announced that the monetary policy committee has unanimously decided to increase the repo rate by 40 bps to 4.40% with immediate effect. Das said that the decision was made after reassessing the inflation growth dynamics and macroeconomic situation. Consequently, the standing deposit facility rate stands adjusted to 4.15%.

291.title: They have the upper hand over RCB: Imran Tahir on 9th placed CSK
291.article_body: Ex-CSK spinner Imran Tahir said CSK who are currently ninth on the IPL 2022 points table, have the upper hand over RCB in their upcoming IPL 2022 match. "RCB will be low on confidence having lost three games," added Tahir. "The match will be very important for CSK," stated Tahir. RCB are currently sixth on the points table.

292.title: 3 labourers die in ammonia tank blast in Goa's Vasco
292.article_body: At least three labourers were killed on the spot after a blast in an ammonia tank at the Zuari Agro Chemicals Limited (ZACL) plant in Goa's Vasco. "The state machinery has immediately responded and is making every effort to bring normalcy to the situation," Goa Chief Minister Pramod Sawant tweeted. Sawant also assured that there was no gas leakage.

293.title: Brown & beautiful: Samantha on Bridgerton star Simone Ashley's Met Gala look
293.article_body: Actress Samantha Ruth Prabhu shared a video of 'Bridgerton' season 2 actress, Simone Ashley, from her appearance at the Met Gala 2022 held on Monday. Sharing the video on her Instagram Stories, Samantha wrote, "Brown and beautiful. #SimoneAshley #Bridgerton." The video showed Simone, who played Kate Sharma on 'Bridgerton 2', posing as she arrived on the red carpet.

294.title: MNS workers detained outside Raj Thackeray’s Mumbai home, 9 in Pune
294.article_body: Mumbai Police detained several Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) workers gathered outside party chief Raj Thackeray's residence, officials said. At least nine MNS workers were also detained when they came out of a temple after performing 'aarti' in Pune, officials added. Notably, Thackeray had asked people to play Hanuman Chalisa outside mosques from May 4 if loudspeakers there were not removed.

295.title: COVID-19 situation not so serious at present: Delhi Health Minister
295.article_body: Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain on Wednesday said the COVID-19 situation in the national capital is not so serious at present. "We have reserved 10,000 beds in hospitals for COVID-19 cases, but less than 200 of those are occupied," Jain added. His remarks came a day after Delhi reported 1,414 new COVID-19 cases and one related death.

296.title: EU to ban 3 Russian state-owned broadcasters amid Ukraine war
296.article_body: European Commission chief Ursula von der Leyen said the European Union will ban three Russian state-owned broadcasters as part of a sixth sanctions package over Ukraine war.  "They will not be allowed to distribute their content anymore...in whatever shape or form," she added. She called the channels "mouthpieces that amplify [Russian President Vladimir] Putin's lies and propaganda aggressively".

297.title: My tweets get more replies than Modiji's tweets: Ola CEO on 'troll attacks'
297.article_body: Ola CEO Bhavish Aggarwal tweeted, "Ola Electric & I are subject to one of the biggest troll attacks in corporate India." He added, "My tweets now get more replies than even Modiji's tweets despite a fraction of his followers." On Wednesday, a Livemint report claimed that dubious Twitter accounts are defending Ola Electric amid the criticism of the company.

298.title: 13-year-old girl raped by policeman when she went to file rape case in UP
298.article_body: A 13-year-old rape survivor in Uttar Pradesh's Lalitpur was allegedly raped again by the station house officer (SHO) when she went to the police station to file a complaint against four men for kidnapping and gangraping her. The police have lodged a case against six people, including the SHO and her aunt. The aunt and two men have been arrested.

299.title: Actress Amy Jackson dating British actor Ed Westwick: Reports
299.article_body: Actress Amy Jackson is reportedly dating British actor Ed Westwick, who's known for his role as 'Chuck Bass' in 'Gossip Girl'. Pictures have surfaced online where Amy was spotted while taking a walk with Ed in London. Amy and Ed met each other for the first time at Saudi Arabia's Red Sea International Film Festival last December, reports added.

300.title: I am not Rahul, I won't run from Amethi: Irani on contesting from Wayanad
300.article_body: Answering a question on whether she would consider contesting elections from Wayanad if BJP asked her to, Union Minister Smriti Irani said, "I am not Rahul Gandhi, I don't run from Amethi." She said this during her visit to Rahul Gandhi's Lok Sabha constituency Wayanad, where she went to review developmental projects. In 2019, Irani defeated Rahul in Amethi.

301.title: Shigella identified as cause of food poisoning in Kerala girl who died
301.article_body: The Kerala Health Department has identified Shigella bacteria as cause of food poisoning in the 16-year-old girl who died after eating shawarma from local eatery. Thirty other people were also hospitalised after eating from the eatery. The District medical officer Dr S K Ramdas said presence of shigella was confirmed after testing the blood and faeces of the patients.

302.title: ICC release team rankings for all formats after annual update
302.article_body: The ICC today released team rankings after the annual update. Australia increased their lead over second-placed India from one to nine rating points in Test rankings. In ODI rankings, New Zealand remain on top, but their lead over England is reduced to one rating point. India remain on top in T20Is, extending their lead over second-placed England to five points.

303.title: Neighbours clash over trivial issues in Delhi's Shahbad; FIRs filed
303.article_body: Delhi Police filed cross FIRs against two neighbours, Kamalkant and Azad, for allegedly fighting over trivial issues and assaulting each other near Peer Baba Mazar in Delhi's Shahbad Dairy area on Tuesday. According to police, first, Azad and his friends attacked Kamalkant and his family at his residence, following which Kamalkant and his friends attacked Azad and his family members.

304.title: Defeat against PBKS bitter pill to swallow: GT's David Miller
304.article_body: GT batter David Miller said their defeat against PBKS on Tuesday was quite a "bitter pill to swallow". He, however, also added, "It's going to happen through the campaign...with so many games. So, hopefully, we got the bad game out the way." Miller, who has scored 287 runs in 10 games this season, got out for 11 runs against PBKS.

305.title: I feel sorry for Ravindra Jadeja but CSK are on the backfoot: Brad Hogg
305.article_body: Talking about Ravindra Jadeja who recently stepped down as CSK captain, ex-KKR spinner Brad Hogg said, "I feel sorry for Jadeja. Jadeja...didn't have the full quota of players. So that's put extra pressure." "But at the end of the day, CSK are on the backfoot. They have made the move," added Hogg. MS Dhoni replaced Jadeja as CSK captain.

306.title: Police release photos of man accused in acid attack in Bengaluru
306.article_body: Kamakshipalya Police have released pictures of the acid attack accused, Nagesh Babu, in different looks and sought help from public to arrest him. Babu has been absconding since last Thursday after he allegedly threw acid on a 24-year-old woman in Bengaluru's Sunkadakatte after she rejected his marriage proposal. Police have formed seven teams comprising over 100 policemen to arrest him.

307.title: There's peace in Maharashtra, no protest being held: Sanjay Raut
307.article_body: There is peace in Maharashtra and no protest is being held in the state, Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut said on Wednesday. "No illegal loudspeakers running in the state...Bal Thackeray and Veer Savarkar are the ones who taught Hindutva to the country." Raut added. "Shiv Sena's school of Hindutva is original," Raut stated.

308.title: Couple booked days after burnt body of 33-yr-old man found in Punjab
308.article_body: Seven days after the burnt body of a 33-year-old man was found in Punjab’s Lalru, police booked a couple in connection with the case. Police recovered the body from a secluded place on April 26. On that day, the deceased man’s brother was told by the accused that they dropped the victim off in Zirakpur.

309.title: Russia learning from early mistakes in Ukraine war, will improve: US
309.article_body: US Defence Secretary Lloyd Austin said that Russia is learning from its mistakes in the early stages of the Ukraine war and will improve their logistical efforts. "We saw them make some bad assumptions at the beginning…We saw them fail to integrate aerial fires with their ground maneuver…We'll see them improve their massing of fires," Austin told the US Congress.

310.title: Astrologers, priests in Telangana decide not to fix muhurta for C-section
310.article_body: Astrologers and priests in Telangana's Karimnagar have joined hands to support the government's initiative to promote normal deliveries and not fix muhurta for the delivery of babies through Caesarean section (C-section). "It has become a practice for people to...fix auspicious time..for deliveries. C-section is advisable only when normal delivery becomes complicated," the District Collector said.

311.title: Akshay Kumar completes 30 years in B'wood; Prithviraj makers unveil poster
311.article_body: Akshay Kumar recently completed 30 years in the Hindi film industry and Yash Raj Films celebrated the actor's special milestone by creating a new 'Prithviraj' poster that features every film that he has been a part of. In the video, Akshay is seen saying, "It didn't...cross my mind that this activity is happening to celebrate my 30 years in cinema!"

312.title: ITBP personnel perform Yoga at height of 17,000 ft in Sikkim Himalayas
312.article_body: The Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP) personnel participated in a Yoga session on Wednesday at an altitude of 17,000 feet amid snow conditions in Sikkim Himalayas, ahead of the International Day of Yoga 2022. A group of around 20 personnel of ITBP were seen performing at least three different Yoga asanas (postures).

313.title: Mother, son die as car collides with tractor in Greater Noida
313.article_body: A 70-year-old woman and her 35-year-old son died as their car collided with a tractor that allegedly came on the wrong lane of an expressway in UP's Greater Noida, police said. The victims were returning to Haryana after purchasing medicines from Meerut, police added. The tractor took a sudden turn and the car crashed into its front portion, police stated.

314.title: Queen of Denmark Margrethe II hosts dinner for PM Modi at Amalienborg Palace
314.article_body: PM Narendra Modi was accorded a warm welcome by the Queen of the Kingdom of Denmark, Margrethe II at Amalienborg Palace in Copenhagen on the second day of his Europe visit. PM Modi also attended a private dinner hosted by the Queen. He felicitated Her Majesty on the occasion of the Golden Jubilee of her reign, the MEA stated.

315.title: Ukraine will win the war: UK PM Boris Johnson
315.article_body: UK PM Boris Johnson on Tuesday said that Ukraine will win the war against Russia. "I have one message for you today - Ukraine will win, Ukraine will be free," said Johnson in a virtual address to the Ukrainian Parliament. "This is Ukraine's finest hour, that will be remembered and recounted for generations to come," he added.

316.title: Shatrughan Sinha and family performed black magic on me, ran 'sex scam': Pooja Mishra
316.article_body: 'Bigg Boss 5' contestant Pooja Mishra, in a recent interview, claimed that veteran actor Shatrughan Sinha and his family performed magic on her. She also claimed that they used to make her unconscious and trade her in a 'sex scam'. She further alleged that they blocked 35 films of her from releasing.

317.title: Ranveer Singh's 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar' to release with 0 cuts: Report
317.article_body: Ranveer Singh-starrer 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar' has reportedly received a U/A certificate from the Central Board of Film Certification (CBFC). "Ranveer is seen threatening to castrate himself in a scene," said a source as quoted by the report. "They gave a clean U/A to the film without asking for any sort of cut," added the source.

318.title: Arshdeep has got a lot of nerve, he has shown that in death overs: Rabada
318.article_body: PBKS pacer Kagiso Rabada has praised his teammate Arshdeep Singh, stating that the 23-year-old has got a lot of "nerve" and he's showing that while bowling in the death overs. "Arshdeep reads the game well, he's able to execute his skill and he's done it game in game out," added Rabada. Arshdeep has picked four wickets in 10 games.

319.title: Delhi Police to take action against its personnel who were absent on Eid
319.article_body: Delhi Police on Tuesday said departmental action would be taken against its personnel of the 'Third Battalion' who were absent on Eid. About 500 personnel of the battalion were deployed across the city on the occasion of Eid, an official said. Notably, tight security arrangements were put in place at major religious places for peaceful progression of namaz.

320.title: Married Australia-returnee among 2 held for stalking Mohali girl
320.article_body: Two men were arrested for allegedly stalking a girl outside Chandigarh’s MCM DAV College in Sector 36. One of the accused recently returned from Australia and started working with an advocate in Mohali, police said. He also recently got married. The victim, a Mohali resident, said that the incident occurred while she was waiting for her father outside the college.

321.title: Father booked for 5-yr-old son's death in bike accident in Panvel
321.article_body: A 36-year-old man has been booked after his five-year-old son died in a bike accident in Panvel near Mumbai. The man was riding the bike while his wife and older son were riding pillion. The deceased child was sitting on the petrol tank when the bike collided with a wall and fell outside a bridge, causing injuries to all.

322.title: Hoped Telugu version wouldn't release, dubbing wasn't good: Director on 'Raja..'
322.article_body: Dharmesh Darshan, director of 'Raja Hindustani', said that he hoped that the producers wouldn't release the film's Telugu version. "The dubbing quality was not good...If a better quality of dubbing was done, it would have become a hit even in the Telugu version...When it failed, everybody agreed that the director was correct," he added.

323.title: Heavy rains lash parts of Hyderabad, waterlogging in many areas
323.article_body: Heavy rains lashed parts of Hyderabad on Wednesday morning causing waterlogging in many areas. Seethafalmandi near Secunderabad received 72.8 mm rainfall, the highest as of 6 am, as per official data. DRF teams have been deployed to clear water stagnations and treefalls, and provide assistance to citizens. Thundershowers are likely to occur in parts of Telangana, IMD said.

324.title: 24-year-old man arrested for raping cousin's wife in Pune
324.article_body: A 24-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly raping his cousin's wife at her house in Pune. The accused had allegedly barged into the 26-year-old woman's house at around 2 am on April 30 and raped her after threatening to tell her husband about their Instagram chats. The accused was arrested after the victim lodged an FIR on Tuesday.

325.title: North Korea fires unidentified projectile into sea, 14th launch this year
325.article_body: North Korea fired an unidentified projectile toward the sea off its east coast on Wednesday, South Korea's military said. Japan's Coast Guard said it could be a ballistic missile. The launch, which marks North Korea's 14th weapons test this year, comes days after North Korean leader Kim Jong-un vowed to bolster his nuclear arsenal "at the fastest possible pace".

326.title: Raj Thackeray shares Bal Thackeray's video amid Hanuman Chalisa row
326.article_body: Amid the Azaan-Hanuman Chalisa row, MNS chief Raj Thackeray tweeted Bal Thackeray's video in which the latter is heard saying that if our government comes to power then we will stop namaz on roads and remove loudspeakers from masjids. Raj Thackeray had appealed to Hindus to play Hanuman Chalisa in places where they hear Azaan being done on loudspeakers today.

327.title: Maha MP Navneet Rana, husband Ravi Rana get bail in Hanuman Chalisa case
327.article_body: Maharashtra's Amravati MP Navneet Rana and her MLA-husband Ravi Rana, who were arrested in connection with the Hanuman Chalisa row, have been granted bail by a Mumbai court. They were arrested on April 23 after they announced to recite Hanuman Chalisa outside CM Uddhav Thackeray's private residence 'Matoshree'. A court had sent the couple to judicial custody till May 6.

328.title: There's need for security agencies to have quick access to info: Shah
328.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Tuesday said there is a need for legal and security agencies to have automated, secure and immediate access to information obtained from reliable sources. "Security requirements today have changed significantly as compared to the earlier security challenges in terms of data, scope and complexity," Shah added.

329.title: Nothing left, haven't eaten in 3 days: Vendor on Banjara Market demolition
329.article_body: Sushila, one of the vendors in Gurugram's Banjara Market, where demolition drive was undertaken recently, said that they have nothing left and that they haven't eaten or taken bath in three days. Another vendor, Chini, said that she was cooking when the machine demolished her house. "They've made us homeless...there has been loss of lakhs and crores," another vendor said.

330.title: BSF personnel injured in accidental firing from his own rifle in Bhuj
330.article_body: A Border Security Force (BSF) personnel was injured after an accidental firing from his own rifle due to rough weather in the sea near Gujarat's Bhuj. "While depositing the weapon...due to extremely high turbulence...Constable Pratap fell down on...the Floating Border Out-Post and accidentally one round got fired from his service rifle piercing the right side of his abdomen," BSF said.

331.title: It’s his woman, those are Kanye’s kids: Hughley on Pete's new tattoo
331.article_body: Discussing the new tattoo of Kim Kardashian's boyfriend Pete Davidson, actor DL Hughley said, "It's his woman, those are Kanye West's kids. If you tattooed my kids on your neck, I would have something to say about it." "That would piss me off," added Hughley. "If you...got my kids tattooed...look, they will always be mine," stated Hughley.

332.title: Another Durgapur-bound SpiceJet flight faces technical issue, returns to Chennai
332.article_body: A Durgapur-bound SpiceJet flight had to return to Chennai after take-off last night due to a technical issue, a SpiceJet spokesperson told the Hindustan Times. The flight reportedly took off after a delay of 6.5 hours. The incident comes after another SpiceJet flight to Durgapur from Mumbai was hit by severe turbulence on Sunday in which 40 people were injured.

333.title: 'Koffee with Karan' will not be returning, announces Karan Johar
333.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar today announced his talk show 'Koffee with Karan' will not be returning.   "Koffee with Karan has been a part of my life, and yours, for 6 seasons now. I'd like to think we've made an impact and even found our place in pop culture history," Johar said. The last season of the show ended in March 2019.

334.title: When I didn't do well, Deepak Chahar called me, gave me tips: Mukesh
334.article_body: CSK pacer Mukesh Choudhary has revealed that their ₹14-crore buy Deepak Chahar, who was ruled out of IPL 2022 due to injury concerns, has been in touch with him and has been guiding him in the ongoing IPL season. "In the initial matches of the tournament, I did not do well. Deepak Bhai called and gave me tips," added Choudhary.

335.title: 24-year-old woman raped, stabbed by 2 men in Gurugram; 1 arrested
335.article_body: A 24-year-old woman was allegedly raped and stabbed by two men in Gurugram's DLF Phase-3 area, police said on Tuesday. "On Monday, I got a desperate call from my wife...When I reached home, she told me she was raped by two [men]...one of them stabbed her," victim's husband said. Police have arrested one accused in connection with the case.

336.title: I sometimes pissed him off: France's Gael Monfils on Novak Djokovic
336.article_body: French tennis player Gael Monfils said he sometimes "pissed off" world number one Novak Djokovic. "Maybe you can beat him once, twice, three times. Me, I never succeeded. But there aren't many guys who beat Usain Bolt," added Monfils. "He has a way of playing that I don't like. Djokovic manages to find my weaknesses every time," stated Monfils.

337.title: UP displayed 'Ganga-Jamuni tehzeeb' during festivities: ADG Prashant Kumar
337.article_body: The people of Uttar Pradesh displayed "traditional Ganga-Jamuni tehzeeb" while celebrating three festivals in a single day, ADG (Law and Order) Prashant Kumar said. "No untoward incident of any kind took place anywhere in the state and people celebrated Eid with traditional fervour and gaiety," he added. Namaz was peacefully offered at around 32,000 places in UP, he further informed.

338.title: Acid attack on woman in Bengaluru was planned well in advance: Police
338.article_body: The acid attack on a 24-year-old woman in Bengaluru was planned "well in advance", the police said. "We have taken the case seriously and our teams have been dispatched across the state and outside the state as well," Bengaluru Police Commissioner Kamal Pant said. The victim sustained serious burns due to acid attack and is undergoing treatment at a hospital.

339.title: Curbs on media, civil society undermine Pakistan's image: US
339.article_body: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken said that restrictions on media and civil society in Pakistan undermine the country's image and its ability to progress. The statement comes after Pakistan fell to 157th position on the World Press Freedom Index. "A vibrant free press, an informed citizenry are key for any nation and its future, including Pakistan," said Blinken.

340.title: Putin signs decree allowing Russia to terminate exports and deals with the West
340.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin has put the West on notice that Russia can terminate exports and deals in response to the sanctions imposed on it over Ukraine's invasion. Putin signed a decree which forbids the export of products and raw materials to people and entities on a sanctions list that he ordered the government to draw up within 10 days.

341.title: Removal of loudspeakers falls under Delhi Police's jurisdiction: AAP
341.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) said that the matter of removal of loudspeakers from religious places falls under Delhi Police's jurisdiction which is under BJP-ruled Cente. "AAP in principle agrees with the concept of repealing loudspeakers from every religious institution," the party said. This comes after BJP wrote to CM Arvind Kejriwal urging him to immediately remove loudspeakers from religious places.

342.title: Grew up before my age, had to be strong as mom, brother were soft: Tejasswi
342.article_body: Actress Tejasswi Prakash said she grew way before her age as her father was away for work during her childhood. “My mother was...soft and emotional person. Pratik [her brother] was very soft...and I used to always have to be...that strong person in...the house,” she said, adding her mother used to lock them in house so they wouldn’t get lost.

343.title: Haryana to distribute 5 lakh free tablets to students from May 5
343.article_body: Haryana government will distribute free tablets to 5 lakh students studying in classes 10 to 12 in government schools from May 5, an official statement read. These devices will come with personalised and adaptive learning software, preloaded content and free internet data. "The scheme will prove to be an effective step towards online education," Chief Minister Manohar Lal Khattar said.

344.title: Never seen a six as big as that one: Pietersen on Livingstone's 117-metre six
344.article_body: Reacting to PBKS all-rounder Liam Livingstone's 117-metre six off GT pacer Mohammad Shami, ex-England captain Kevin Pietersen said, "I've never seen a six as big as that one." Livingstone smashed three sixes and two fours in his unbeaten 30-run innings. "Nice to go out and hit a few out the middle," said Livingstone after the game.

345.title: City can win 2nd leg vs Madrid playing way worse than 1st leg: Guardiola
345.article_body: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola said his team can win the second leg of their Champions League semi-final against Real Madrid, despite playing "much, much worse" than their performance in the first leg. "Football is unpredictable," added Guardiola. City defeated Real Madrid 4-3 in the first leg with Kevin De Bruyne, Bernardo Silva among the goalscorers.

346.title: Protests erupt in Germany after man dies during police operation
346.article_body: Hundreds of people reportedly staged protests in Germany after a man died during a police operation. In purported videos that surfaced following the incident, a police officer appeared to hit the man in the head. The authorities said that the man, who was stopped by the police, refused to cooperate, after which the officers used force.

347.title: Imran Khan attends cousin Ira Khan's Eid celebrations, pic surfaces
347.article_body: Imran Khan, who had quit acting in 2018, was seen in a picture shared by his cousin Ira Khan from her Eid celebrations. The former actor was spotted wearing a pathani kurta-pyjama in the photo. Ira captioned the post, "Did you know you're eligible for Eidi till you're married?! I thought once you're an adult (18) it's done."

348.title: Hyd IAS officer says someone asking for money in his name, says 'not me'
348.article_body: IAS officer from Hyderabad, Arvind Kumar, took to Twitter to share a screenshot with a number, claiming that someone was sending messages in his name. "Someone is sending messages...asking for money from my staff/others!! Upon being informed, I have filed immediately a police complaint.
