It's not me and please ignore any message if received," he wrote.

349.title: 37-yr-old man kills friend, chops off body & dumps in Ludhiana canal
349.article_body: A 37-year-old man was arrested for allegedly murdering his friend and cutting the body into several pieces before dumping in Ludhiana. The parts of victim's dismembered body were recovered from Sidhwan Canal. The accused allegedly killed the 30-year-old victim at his rented room on April 18. He purportedly killed him with intention to rob ₹25,000 cash from him, police said.

350.title: Sidharth Malhotra, Kiara Advani spotted together at Eid bash amid breakup reports
350.article_body: Actors Sidharth Malhotra and Kiara Advani were spotted together at Arpita Khan's Eid bash amid breakup reports. The two posed separately for the photographers upon their arrival, but went inside the venue together. "Rumours smashed," a fan commented on a video of them entering the venue together. "They look amazing together," another wrote.

351.title: Batting first wasn't wrong, we needed to get out of our comfort zone: Hardik
351.article_body: GT captain Hardik Pandya said batting first after winning the toss against PBKS wasn't a wrong call as he wanted his team to get out of their comfort zone. He added, "We've chased well in this tournament, if required (later on), we had to know how to set targets." GT managed to post 143/8 and lost by eight wickets.

352.title: 'Fake priest' spends night at army barracks near Queen Elizabeth's castle
352.article_body: The UK Army has launched an investigation following reports that a man pretending to be a priest spent a night at a barracks with soldiers tasked with protecting Queen Elizabeth II near her Windsor Castle home. He allegedly spent the night eating and drinking with soldiers. The Queen was not in castle when the incident reportedly took place last Wednesday.

353.title: Mamata will be PM in 2024, Abhishek CM, says TMC MP; deletes tweet
353.article_body: TMC MP Aparupa Poddar on Tuesday tweeted, "In 2024, Mamata Banerjee will be sworn in as the Prime Minister by an RSS-selected President; Abhishek Banerjee will become the Chief Minister of Bengal." She deleted the tweet later. Asked about it by mediapersons, Poddar said, "It is true that we want to see Mamata Banerjee becoming the PM in 2024."

354.title: Odisha govt transfers ₹800 cr financial assistance to 40 lakh farmers
354.article_body: Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik on Tuesday transferred ₹800 crore directly to the bank account of 40 lakh farmers of the state as financial assistance. "Development of agriculture and farmers' welfare is the most important program of the state government," he said. "This year more than ₹20,000 crore has been provided in the budget for agriculture," Patnaik further said.

355.title: Was told to leave via back door, angry Kanpur crowd broke shop's glass: Divyenndu
355.article_body: Actor Divyenndu said he was asked to leave via the back door while shooting at a cyber cafe in Kanpur because "it was really crowded" outside. "These guys [people outside] really got angry so they broke the glass of the shop...In Mumbai...when I step out, people recognise me...but they are more civil...and don't really encroach upon your territory," he added.

356.title: Turn your home into a smart home with Alexa Smart Home Combo: Amazon
356.article_body: With the launch of the Amazon Summer Sale on May 4, Amazon announced that customers can now convert their home into a smart home with Alexa Smart Home Combo at an unbelievable price of ₹2,999. The Alexa Smart Home Combo requires no rewiring and is easy to install, letting customers experience the convenience of hands-free voice control, the company added.

357.title: India's largest IPO of LIC opens for subscription
357.article_body: Life Insurance Corporation's (LIC) IPO, which is India's largest, opened for subscription today. The price band of the IPO is ₹902-949, with a ₹60 discount for policyholders and ₹45 discount for retail investors and employees. The IPO, through which the government is selling its 3.5% LIC stake to raise ₹20,557 crore, will close for subscription on May 9.

358.title: India registered 6% rise in deaths in pandemic year 2020: CRS data
358.article_body: India registered 81.16 lakh deaths in 2020, during the COVID-19 pandemic year, which is about 6% higher than the previous year’s number, as per the data released by the Civil Registration System (CRS). India registered 76.41 lakh deaths in 2019. The number of registered births in 2020 declined from 2.48 crore in 2019 to 2.42 crore, according to the data.

359.title: Mumbai witnesses rise in viral diarrhoea cases among children
359.article_body: There is an unusual rise in number of viral infection cases among children, especially diarrhoea, which is one of the causes of dehydration, Mumbai's paediatricians said. "Daily, we are seeing 5 to 10 cases of diarrhoea in children," paediatrician Dr Vishal Parmar said. The diarrhoea cases in children are more this year compared to the last two years, he added.

360.title: Deepika, Ranveer, Kangana and Karan Johar attend Eid party, pics surface
360.article_body: Several celebrities including actors Deepika Padukone, Ranveer Singh, Kangana Ranaut and Karan Johar attended Arpita Khan's Eid party on Tuesday. Kangana was decked up in a white sharara. Meanwhile, Deepika was seen in a black embroidered kurta salwar and Ranveer donned a colourful printed shirt. The duo also posed for the paparazzi. Karan attended the party wearing a black kurta.

361.title: We're trying to get best out of Bairstow, so I said, 'I'll bat at no. 4': Mayank
361.article_body: After their win against GT, PBKS captain Mayank Agarwal said there's no better time to get back-to-back wins in the ongoing IPL season. On demoting himself in batting order while chasing GT's 143-run total, Mayank said, "We're trying to get the best out of Jonny Bairstow. He's done well opening...[so] I said, 'I'll bat at four, I'll anchor the innings'."

362.title: CBI inspects Kerala CM's house in sexual abuse case against Chandy
362.article_body: CBI on Tuesday conducted an inspection at the Cliff House, Kerala Chief Minister's official residence, to collect evidence in connection with the sexual abuse case against former CM Oommen Chandy. Five Congress leaders, including Chandy, are accused of sexually abusing the prime woman accused in the solar panel scam. Chandy had allegedly sexually abused her at Cliff House in 2012.

363.title: 43-year-old man arrested with Mephedrone worth over ₹11 lakh in Pune
363.article_body: The Pune unit of the Anti-Terrorism Squad (ATS) has arrested a 43-year-old man, a resident of Mumbai, and seized 118 grams of Mephedrone worth over ₹11 lakh from him. Acting on a tip-off, the ATS laid a trap to arrest the accused near the Pune railway station on Monday afternoon. The ATS has launched a search for his three accomplices.

364.title: Armed men posing as police officers, rob ₹65,000 from Ambala ashram
364.article_body: Five masked men armed with weapons and sticks posed as police officers from a nearby station and allegedly robbed two priests of ₹65,000 at an ashram in Ambala's Khatauli village on Monday around 1:30 am. "They started thrashing us and took away...cash from the almirah. They also snatched gold...silver jewellery from us...and seven mobile phones," one of the priests said.

365.title: India sees 3,205 new COVID-19 cases, a jump of 24.8% in daily cases
365.article_body: India has reported 3,205 COVID-19 cases, 2,802 recoveries and 31 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 2,568 COVID-19 cases and 20 deaths. Active cases in India stand at 19,509, while the death toll has risen to 5,23,920.

366.title: Withdraw cases against Dalits or Gujarat Bandh on June 1: Mevani
366.article_body: Gujarat MLA Jignesh Mevani has called for a statewide bandh on June 1 if the government does not withdraw cases filed against Dalits for protesting over the 2016 Una flogging incident. Addressing a rally in Ahmedabad, Mevani said, "The cases should be withdrawn the way cases related to Patidar agitation were withdrawn."

367.title: Liverpool enter Champions League final for 3rd time in 5 yrs
367.article_body: Liverpool defeated Villarreal 3-2 in their Champions League semi-final second leg, winning the tie 5-2 on aggregate. This is the third time in five years that Liverpool have entered the Champions League final. Notably, Jurgen Klopp's side also broke their single-season goalscoring record in the match. They have now scored 139 goals in 57 games in all competitions this season.

368.title: On-field players' reactions to IPL 2022's biggest six go viral
368.article_body: PBKS batting all-rounder Liam Livingstone smashed the biggest six of IPL 2022 off GT pacer Mohammad Shami on Tuesday. After the ball covered a distance of 117 metres, reactions of several players including Shami and PBKS captain Mayank Agarwal went viral. Shami was seen smiling, while Agarwal seemed shocked. Meanwhile, GT vice-captain Rashid Khan was seen checking Livingstone's bat.

369.title: My son Ibrahim says he looks like young Saif: Saif on their similar looks
369.article_body: Speaking about him and his son having strikingly similar looks, actor Saif Ali Khan said, "He also says I look like...young Saif." "[Ibrahim] sent me a picture of him, looking good and said this is what I'd look like if I was a 20-year-old 'Vikram Vedha' actor," he added. Saif said that he hopes his son's future goes well.

370.title: Rafael Nadal is my greatest rival of all time: Novak Djokovic
370.article_body: World number one Novak Djokovic said Spain's Rafael Nadal is his "greatest" rival of all time. "We have not been in the same draw for a while," added Djokovic. "We are both trying to do our best to compete for the top spots of the world," stated Djokovic. "I think we are still going strong," said Djokovic.

371.title: India working towards making its airports carbon neutral: Scindia
371.article_body: India is working towards making its airports carbon neutral in the near future, Union Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia said. India is working in this direction to emerge as a responsible player in the international civil aviation industry, Scindia added. "With a robust and holistic plan for the future, we are sure, we will set new milestones in air, soon," Scindia stated.

372.title: Guj govt is 'nikamma', Assam Police kidnapping MLA an insult: Jignesh
372.article_body: Dalit leader and MLA Jignesh Mevani called the Gujarat government "nikamma" and said that the Assam Police kidnapping an MLA is an insult to the 6.5 crore people of Gujarat. "You could do nothing when the Assam police came to Gujarat to trample upon its pride. You should be ashamed of it," he added.

373.title: Aviation sector showed resilience by bouncing back post-COVID: Scindia
373.article_body: Union Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia on Tuesday said that the manner in which Indian civil aviation has bounced back post-COVID-19, with all protocols in place, shows its resilience and determination. "Pre-COVID-19, the maximum number of passengers per day in India was roughly 4,00,000. Ten days ago, we touched the figure of 4,07,000," Scindia added.

374.title: People will watch good content, we shouldn't just crave for our gains: Amit
374.article_body: Actor Amit Sadh said OTT has an understanding and a process which is going ahead smoothly. "The theatrical releases were halted due to COVID-19. Thus...filmmakers were suffering," added Amit. "Whenever good content is made, people will watch it. We should not just crave for our gains," stated Amit. "The industry need not belong to a particular production house," said Amit.

375.title: Man attacks friend for refusing to lend ₹50 in south Mumbai; held
375.article_body: A 30-year-old daily wage worker was allegedly attacked in south Mumbai by an acquaintance of his, after he denied to give him ₹50 for some personal work. The incident occurred near Yellow Gate when the victim refused to lend money, following which the accused attacked him with a knife. Subsequently, a police team reached the spot and arrested the accused.

376.title: Over 6,000 trees blossom with state flower across Mumbai
376.article_body: The Tamhan, which is the state flower of Maharashtra, has started blooming across Mumbai, including entrance of BMC headquarters. "It blooms every year during this season, especially around Maharashtra Day. There are a total of 6,568 Tamhan trees across Mumbai," head of the BMC's garden department said. The tree has many medical uses, another official from the garden department said.

377.title: He flung in air, they ran over him: Friend of Noida's road rage victim
377.article_body: Himanshu Agrawal, friend of Divakar Motwani who was hit by a car in Noida in alleged road rage incident on Saturday, said Divakar had "flung into air" after being hit. "Then they ran over him," Agrawal said. Five persons were arrested for allegedly running over Motwani. The victim continues to be critical with head injuries and multiple leg fractures.

378.title: Minor held for 77-yr-old man's murder, robbery in Delhi's Civil Lines
378.article_body: Delhi Police on Tuesday arrested a 16-year-old boy for the murder of a 77-year-old man in North Delhi's Civil Lines area. Ram Kishore Agrawal was found dead at his home on Sunday and around ₹50 lakh were found to be stolen from his house. Police arrested the accused by scanning over 300 CCTV cameras and tracing his metro card.

379.title: Bengaluru reports 100 of Karnataka's 107 new COVID-19 cases
379.article_body: Karnataka on Tuesday reported 107 new COVID-19 cases, out of which 100 were reported in Bengaluru alone. The city also reported 103 recoveries in the last 24 hours, according to data published by Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP). The number of active cases in Bengaluru now stands at 1,728 with a positivity rate of 1.67%, the data showed.

380.title: 97 arrested in Jodhpur after clashes on Eid, curfew in several areas
380.article_body: As many as 97 people have been arrested in connection with the clashes that broke out at Jalori Gate in Rajasthan's Jodhpur on Eid. Curfew remains in 10 police station areas and internet services have been suspended. The reason for the escalation of tensions resulted from one community hoisting an Eid flag over a freedom fighter's statue, police added.

381.title: As Yamuna water depletes, Delhi requests Haryana to share more
381.article_body: The Delhi Jal Board (DJB) wrote a second letter to the Haryana Irrigation Department in a week, requesting it to release additional water. The DJB said that the Yamuna water level at Wazirabad pond has dropped by about two feet, which could affect water production adversely. It requested for an additional 150 cusecs of water till the arrival of monsoon.

382.title: Cylinder explodes in a shanty in Mohali; 4 injured
382.article_body: Four persons were injured in fire after a cylinder exploded in a shanty near Phase-10 in Mohali on Tuesday around 10 pm. "The fire broke out due to gas leakage, following which the cylinder exploded," police said. Some labourers were reportedly cooking food in the shanty at that time. The injured people were taken to a government hospital, police said.

383.title: Mangoes get QR codes to help Pune buyers know trees they're picked from
383.article_body: QR codes have been stuck on mangoes at the mango festival organised by the MahaFPC in Pune. The QR code aims to provide the buyers with source information about the fruits including which tree they were picked from. Reports said that unique QR codes are generated for mangoes and the information about the harvest is fed into the system.

384.title: Hyderabad Police busts organised cricket betting racket, 8 arrested
384.article_body: Hyderabad Police on Monday busted an organised cricket betting racket and arrested eight people in Secunderabad's Sindhi Colony. Police also seized ₹4.5 lakh in cash from the accused persons. "One of the accused and his team procured and set up online cricket betting equipment such as a call connector box, laptop and cell phones inside his car," police added.

385.title: Liam Livingstone smashes the biggest six of IPL 2022, IPL share video
385.article_body: PBKS batting all-rounder Liam Livingstone smashed a 117-metre maximum on the bowling of GT fast bowler Mohammad Shami to record the biggest six of IPL 2022 so far. The previous biggest six of the tournament was hit by MI's 19-year-old batter Dewald Brevis, who had smashed a 112-metre six against PBKS leg-spinner Rahul Chahar.

386.title: Twitter may charge slight fee for commercial, government users: Musk
386.article_body: Elon Musk has said that Twitter will always be free for casual users but may charge a slight fee for commercial and government users. After the Tesla CEO struck a deal to buy Twitter, he said he wanted to enhance the platform with new features, make the algorithms open source to increase trust, defeat spam bots, and authenticate all humans.

387.title: List of Indian cities with highest maximum temperature on Tuesday released
387.article_body: The highest maximum temperature in the country on Tuesday was reported at Wardha and Rajnandgaon at 44.5°C each. No heat wave was recorded in the country on Tuesday. Maharashtra's Chandrapur witnessed the maximum temperature of 44.4°C, with a total of six stations across the country reporting maximum temperature of 44°C or more.

388.title: 21-yr-old student stabbed to death by ex-boyfriend in West Bengal
388.article_body: A 21-year-old student, Sutapa Chowdhury, was stabbed to death outside her college mess in West Bengal's Berhampore. As per the preliminary investigation, the police suspect the alleged killer, 22-year-old Sushanta Chowdhury, to be her ex-boyfriend. They said that the accused, who was arrested following the incident, has confessed to the crime. The incident was reportedly caught on CCTV camera.

389.title: 8-month-old boy found dead in rooftop water tank in Delhi's Dallupura
389.article_body: An eight-month-old boy drowned in a rooftop water tank in Delhi's Dallupura on Tuesday, police said. The incident took place when his mother went outside leaving her three kids in a room which was latched from outside, police added. Police are investigating how the child reached the roof when the room was locked from the outside, an officer said.

390.title: PBKS hand GT their 2nd defeat of IPL 2022, jump to 5th on points table
390.article_body: PBKS chased down the 144-run target against GT in 16 overs to register their fifth win in IPL 2022. With the win, PBKS jumped to the fifth position on the points table. Table-toppers GT have now lost two matches in IPL 2022. Shikhar Dhawan top-scored for PBKS with 62*(53), while Liam Livingstone smashed an unbeaten 30 off 10 deliveries.

391.title: Delhi reports 1,414 COVID-19 cases & 1 death in last 24 hrs
391.article_body: Delhi reported 1,414 new COVID-19 cases and one related death in the last 24 hours, taking the overall infection tally in the city to 18,87,050. The national capital reported 1,171 recoveries and the active cases stand at 5,986, while the positivity rate is 5.97%. Delhi on Monday had reported 1,076 COVID-19 cases and no related deaths.

392.title: Ninth accused in Noida mall fight that led to man's death arrested
392.article_body: Noida Police said that the ninth accused was arrested in the mall fight case, in which 30-year-old Brijesh Rai was beaten to death at Lost Lemons pub at Gardens Galleria mall. The accused, Jaiveer Singh, a native of Haryana's Jind district, worked at the bar and was arrested from a bus stand at the Mahamaya flyover.

393.title: Delhi sees maximum temperature of 38.4°C; IMD predicts dust storm tomorrow
393.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted a possibility of dust storm or thunderstorm with partly cloudy sky in Delhi on Wednesday. The minimum and maximum temperatures in the city on Wednesday are likely to settle at 27°C and 40°C, respectively, as per IMD data. The maximum temperature in the national capital was recorded at 38.4°C on Tuesday.

394.title: Absolutely: Vettori on whether players should be allowed to review wides
394.article_body: On being asked whether players should be allowed to review wides, ex-New Zealand captian Daniel Vettori said, "Abosutely. The players should be able to decide in such crucial matters." He added, "That's why DRS was brought in...to rectify mistakes. I'd like to see that happen...and players are very good judges of that. They get it right more often than not."

395.title: Ukrainian nurse who lost both legs shares dance with husband, govt shares video
395.article_body: A 23-year-old Ukrainian nurse who lost her legs in a Russian landmine explosion shared the first dance with her husband after getting married in a Lviv hospital. Victor, the groom, carried wife Oksana in his arms as they danced in a ward. Calling it a "very special love story", Ukrainian Parliament tweeted that the woman is preparing for prosthetic surgery.

396.title: Nadal is an outlier: Spanish Tennis Federation President Diaz
396.article_body: Spanish Tennis Federation Miguel Diaz has praised Rafael Nadal, saying the 21-time Grand Slam champion is an "outlier". He stated, "At one point, he was half limping into training. To win what you have won is extraordinary," he added. The Spaniard has won three titles so far in 2022. He will be playing at the Madrid Open this week.

397.title: Necessary to get out of consumption oriented approach: PM Modi
397.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday said it's necessary for the world to get out of consumption oriented approach. "The need of the hour is to promote 'LIFE -- Lifestyle for Environment'...The mindset of use and throw is negative for the planet...The amount of resources we consume must depend on our need, not on our pocket's size," PM Modi said.

398.title: Fire breaks out at scrap godown of MCD office in Delhi
398.article_body: A major fire broke out in the scrap godown of MCD office in Delhi's Keshav Puram on Tuesday evening, officials said. According to fire officials, information regarding the fire was received at 5:25 pm, following which eight to nine fire tenders were rushed to the spot. Short-circuit is suspected to be the reason behind the fire, an NDMC official said.

399.title: Germany's Opposition leader visits Ukraine's Kyiv amid war
399.article_body: Germany's Opposition leader Friedrich Merz travelled to Ukraine's Kyiv on Tuesday for meetings with Ukrainian officials. Speaking to reporters in Irpin, on the outskirts of Kyiv, Merz expressed his "full admiration" for the Ukrainian military for having halted the Russian advance at the town. German Chancellor Olaf Scholz is yet to visit Kyiv despite visits from several European leaders.

400.title: Taiwan seeks timely delivery of Stinger missiles from US
400.article_body: Taiwan's Defence Ministry on Tuesday said that deliveries of shoulder-fired Stinger anti-aircraft missiles from the US could be delayed, amid pressure on supplies due to the war in Ukraine. There is a high demand for missiles in Ukraine, where they've been very successful against Russian aircraft, according to Reuters. The ministry said that it's pressing for timely delivery of missiles.

401.title: Finishers stepping up is main reason behind GT's success: Rajput
401.article_body: Discussing the form of GT's finishers in IPL 2022, Lalchand Rajput said, "In a team, if you've got two or three finishers and if one gets out...other two can continue the momentum." He added this is what's making GT successful as skipper Hardik Pandya is an "excellent finisher". Rajput called Rahul Tewatia one of the best finishers in recent times.

402.title: RPI(A) will protect mosques if loudspeakers are removed: Minister
402.article_body: Union Minister Ramdas Athawale on Tuesday said workers of his Republican Party of India (A) will protect mosques if anyone tried to remove loudspeakers from there forcibly. "We are not against playing Hanuman Chalisa outside a mosque. If Raj Thackeray gives an ultimatum to have these loudspeakers removed, then workers of my party will protect mosques," Athawale added.

403.title: Rahul Gandhi, Priyanka Gandhi Vadra do part-time politics: Rathore
403.article_body: Condemning Rahul Gandhi over his viral video, BJP MP Rajyavardhan Rathore said Rahul Gandhi and Priyanka Gandhi Vadra do part-time politics. Calling the Congress government in Rajasthan "useless", Rathore questioned why the Congress government was not working on its responsibilities. Rathore's comment came after Congress MP Rahul Gandhi was seen in a viral video at a nightclub in Kathmandu.
